* The vehicle has a chassis, a rider riding surface, means for steering, braking, and harnessing the rider, and suspension systems for absorbing shock.
* The text discusses the benefits of the vehicle, including its steerability, stability, and ability to be retrofitted with different components for various terrain types.
* The text also mentions specific components of the vehicle, such as axle assemblies, wheels and tires, and braking systems.
* The text includes references to related art and prior patents, which do not teach the invention disclosed in the application.
* The text concludes by summarizing the essential elements of the invention and stating that there may be variations in the size, shape, and materials used in the construction of the vehicle.

<summary>

- The invention is a board game with a lake theme that includes a playing board, tokens, title deed cards, game pieces, a source of scrip, cards, and elements for randomly determining movement of tokens.
- The playing board has a continuous path of spaces defining a path about a periphery, with some spaces representing lake areas, dams, and boat dealerships that can be purchased with scrip.
- Each title deed card is associated with a respective lake area, dam, or boat dealership and bears indicia indicating a rental payment payable to a player acquiring the property and payable by a player landing upon the space.
- Players move their tokens along the board based on the roll of dice or other chance-determining elements, and landing on a lake area, dam, or boat dealership allows a player to purchase it from the Bank if it is not already owned.
- Rent must be paid to the owner of a lake area, dam, or boat dealership if a player's token lands on a space owned by another player. The rental fee depends on the number of similar properties owned by the player.
- Players can improve their lake areas by erecting lake cabins and marinas, which increase the rental payment for trespassing players.
- The game continues until all but one player is bankrupt, at which point the remaining player is declared the winner.

</summary>

<summary>

- The present invention relates to a wave-based imaging method and apparatus using Radial Reflection Diffraction Tomography (RRDT).
- The method includes directing predetermined energy waves radially outward from within an interspace and receiving scattered energy waves from one or more objects.
- The received data are processed using a wave-based algorithm to map angular location and frequency parameters of the received scattered energy waves to construct images of the objects.
- The invention can be used for various applications, including characterizing plaque in arteries, evaluating materials in waste drums or weapons, and determining the state of parts with existing access holes.
- The RRDT method can be combined with elastography to gain further insight into a surrounding medium's elastic properties and predict plaque composition.
- The Hilbert space inverse wave (HSIW) algorithm is used to invert the scattering collected fields and form images.
- The HSIW algorithm interprets the forward scattering equation as a mapping from a continuous object space to a discrete measurement space.
- The singular value decomposition (SVD) of the forward scattering operator is used to derive an inverse of the operator.
- The method is flexible and allows any transducer configurations and number of frequencies to be used in forming the final reconstruction.

</summary>

• The text describes various embodiments of a garnish pick with one or more appendages that can hook onto the rim of a glass or skewer garnishes.
• The garnish pick may include a main shaft and one or more appendages, with the appendages serving as hooks or skewering shafts.
• The garnish pick may be designed to simulate the appearance of an organism or a portion thereof, such as a branch of a tree or an antler of an animal.
• The garnish pick may have a total length approximately equal to the distance from the rim of a martini glass to the center of the bottom of the glass, but other suitable lengths may be used.
• The garnish pick may have a total diameter or width of 15 cm or less, with the diameter or width diminishing toward the sharp end of the skewering shafts.
• The main shaft and/or appendages may have various shapes, sizes, and textures, including circular, convolute, ovular, non-circular, square or rectangular, pentagonal, hexagonal, or irregularly shaped cross-sections, and twists or corkscrews.
• The garnish pick may be made of various materials, including wood, plastic, rubber, metal, glass, or ceramic.
• The garnish pick may have multiple appendages that project from the main shaft at the same or different angles relative to each other along a longitudinal axis and/or an orthogonal axis.
• The garnish pick may include a hook at the end of the main shaft or on one of the appendages to prevent the pick from becoming completely or further submerged in a beverage.
• The garnish pick may eliminate the need to retrieve the pick out of the beverage or beverage container using fingers and make it easier to eat garnishes off of the pick without touching them with fingers.

* The text describes a study on the effects of a copepod oil composition on atherosclerotic plaque formation and blood cholesterol levels in mice.
* The study compared the effects of the copepod oil composition to those of a concentrated EPA/DHA preparation, both providing the same amount of EPA and DHA.
* The results showed that the copepod oil composition had a statistically significant ability to inhibit atherosclerotic plaque formation, while the EPA/DHA preparation did not.
* The copepod oil composition also had a notable effect on reducing blood cholesterol levels, while the EPA/DHA preparation had no effect.
* The copepod oil composition is derived from a marine copepod and contains a high proportion of wax esters and long chain alcohols.
* The study concluded that the copepod oil composition has markedly different biological effects than concentrated EPA/DHA and may be useful in the prevention and treatment of cardiovascular disease.

* The text describes a hospital bed support assembly with a deck support frame and adjustable legs.
* The legs are connected to the deck support frame through moveable upper pivot elements and stabilizer elements, and are pivotally connected to the floor through lower cross-elements and castors.
* The side rail elements of the deck support frame have hollow channel elements with inner surfaces that engage rollers on the upper ends of the legs.
* The bed can be raised or lowered by extending or retracting actuator rods, which causes the legs and rollers to roll against the inner surfaces of the channel elements. Optional braking mechanisms can be provided on the castors to prevent the bed from moving when in the lowered position.

• The invention is a golf ball teeing device that allows a golfer to insert a golf tee into the ground with a golf ball on top without bending over.
• The device utilizes a delayed urging means that becomes further compressed when the tee is pushed into the ground, automatically unclamping the ball and tee once the tee is securely in the ground.
• The device can be attached to a golf club grip, allowing the golfer to use the golf club as the handle and eliminating the need for a long handle with an unclamping control.
• The device is small, portable, and requires few parts, making it lightweight and efficient to produce.
• The device can be used to retrieve golf tees that are lying horizontally on the ground or still vertically inserted into the ground, without the need to bend over.

• The text describes the invention of pharmaceutical compositions containing polyelectrolyte complexes and active substances.
• Polyelectrolyte complexes are formed by mixing aqueous solutions of a polyacid and a polybase, resulting in microparticulate precipitates.
• The microparticles can be prepared in various sizes and can incorporate active substances by entrapment, absorption, chemical binding, or using the active substance as a partner in the complex formation.
• The invention provides formulations with diverse consistency properties and release profiles, suitable for various pharmaceutical applications such as vaccines, cytostatics, and contrast agents for ultrasonic diagnosis.
• Examples of the preparation and characterization of polyelectrolyte complex microparticles with different active substances, including daunorubicin, human serum albumin, tetracycline, and rabies vaccine, are provided.

<summary>
• The invention is a dental cleaning and massaging apparatus that uses hydraulic means to clean teeth and gingival crevices and provides gentle gum massaging.
• The apparatus consists of a mouthpiece with upper and lower channel members, a first and second membrane, bite blocks, hoses, and air-sacks. The upper and lower channel members fit over the teeth and snugly against the gums, and the membranes and bite blocks create a sealed area for fluid and air to move.
• The apparatus operates by providing air pulses to inflate and deflate air-sacks, which massage the gums while the teeth remain in place. Simultaneously, water or cleaning fluid is introduced into the mouth to clean and lubricate the teeth and gums.
</summary>

<summary>

- The text describes an invention related to a device and method for treating and regenerating tissues, particularly in the context of wounds.
- The invention concerns a new device that allows for both liquid fluid supply and suction, and can be used for both non-regenerative and regenerative tissue treatment.
- The device includes a pole, a rest, a fluid reservoir, and means for controlling the fluid supply and suction. The rest is movable in vertical directions along the pole and can be secured at a height corresponding to the height of the tissue.
- The fluid reservoir can be a pliable and flexible bag filled with treatment fluid, and the controlling means can include a drip chamber, a roller clamp, a level meter, or an injection port.
- The apparatus can also include a drop-sensitive sensor for assessing the flow rate, a suction pump, and a motor for moving the rest in a vertical direction.
- The method for using the device involves applying continuous suction to the drainage port, perforating the supply port elastic injection membrane with a needle during ongoing suction, and injecting the content of the syringe into the dressing pad.
- The apparatus also includes a means to prevent ingress of air through the supply port during fluid administration, and a drainage port with an open grid to counteract occlusion of the underlying open pores of the pad when exposed to continuous suction.

</summary>

Additionally, the text mentions a method for detecting bleeding from a wound during continuous suctioning treatment using a receptacle, a scale, a canister, movement buffer organs, a computer, visual display, audible alarm, and telemetry. The method involves determining the baseline rate and variability of therapeutic fluid formation over time, determining the minimal rate of fluid formed in addition to the baseline rate which is to be considered as a sign of bleeding, and making the computer subtract incoming rates of fluid formation from the baseline serially and giving an audible, visual, and telemetric alarm once bleeding is detected.

• The invention describes an electro-surgical dissecting and cauterizing instrument for use in laparoscopic procedures, which includes a rigid arm extending from the sleeve to the working tip electrode, reducing obstruction of the surgeon's view of the operation site.
• The instrument includes an electrical insulating layer along the entire length of the tool up to the exposed working tip electrode, eliminating inadvertent cauterization of healthy tissue.
• The instrument comes in various working tip electrode configurations, such as a hook and a flattened spatula, and the arm portion of the tool is laterally offset from the longitudinal axis of the sleeve, providing maximum visualization of the working tip electrode and operation site.
• The invention also includes a single-use, disposable electro-surgical and cauterizing instrument for endoscopic procedures, designed for easy handling and use by the surgeon.

* The present invention relates to a needle for surgical threading of a strap of an implant through a tissue, featuring a trap for trapping the strap, a tip for threading the trapped strap, and a mechanism for releasing the trap from the accessible side of the tissue.
* The invention also includes an anterior implant with straps threaded into the arcus tendineous fascia pelvic (ATFP) ligaments and sacrospinous (SS) ligaments, and a loop between the second straps for anchoring to the cervix.
* A posterior implant is also described, featuring straps threaded into the sacrospinous ligaments, a first loop anchored to the cervix, and a second loop anchored to the perineal body.
* The invention includes a method for using a needle to thread a strap through a surface, involving trapping an end of the strap, threading the needle and trapped strap through the surface, releasing the trap, and returning the needle to the accessible side while abandoning the strap at the threaded point.

<summary>
• The present invention relates to a new type of releasable fastener for albums with front and back covers and removable pages.
• The fastener consists of a pair of strap anchors, a strap, and means for providing a releasable connection between the strap and each anchor.
• Each strap anchor is in the form of a channel with snap-locks to securely hold the strap in place.
• The strap enters the channel through an aperture and is locked in place by snapping beneath locking lips.
• The strap anchors can be attached to the covers using adhesive, and the strap is of a semi-rigid material that can be easily inserted through the aligned holes in the covers and album pages.
• The new fastener system allows for easier insertion and removal of pages compared to conventional screw-type fasteners, and the length of the strap determines the thickness of the album.
</summary>

<summary>
• The present invention relates to a new sulky design that can be manufactured using lightweight and durable materials such as aluminum and reinforced plastics.
• The sulky's shafts and crossbar transfer all the load to the wheel planes, resulting in a stable construction.
• The end frames are casted using a chill-casting or press-casting process, while the crossbar is manufactured from extruded aluminum or a similar light metal.
• The crossbar is fastened to the mounting bushings in the end frames using threaded holes and strengthening elements that ensure a stable and rigid frame.
• The sulky's components can be easily assembled by the user using ordinary hand tools, and all connections become secure without any play.
• The new sulky design results in a weight reduction of approximately 40% compared to traditional sulkies, and the sulky can be easily dismantled and stored in a flat package.
</summary>

<summary>

- The present invention relates to a ventilation system for rotating water feeds in water-cooled generators to eliminate accumulated air or gas bubbles.
- The invention provides at least one bypass with inlets and outlets between the feed and discharge ducts, with at least one inlet opening into the space around the axis of rotation.
- The advantages of the invention include rapid and complete removal of bubbles using the pressure gradient between inflow and outflow for automatic operation.
- The invention also provides a relatively simple design for the ventilation system.
- In a preferred embodiment, the bypass is arranged in or on the end face of the feed ducts.
- The bypass can also be designed as a coiled pipe to minimize leakage and bypass.
- The bypass can be structured to include means for increasing hydrodynamic resistance for adequate pressure drop over a short distance.
- The invention eliminates air or gas bubbles by providing inlets in the space around the axis of rotation where bubbles accumulate due to lowest pressure point.

</summary>

<summary>
• The present invention relates to a magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) apparatus with a magnet, patient receptacle, support plate, and transmit and receive coils for exposures in two predetermined positions.
• In known MRI apparatuses, exposure parameters must be modified for different exposure positions, requiring adjustments to optimize the RF chain and main magnetic field homogeneity.
• These adjustments can take 10 to 90 seconds per exposure position, making it difficult to track contrast agent doses over larger body regions without a smaller viewing field or multiple injections.
• The inventive MRI apparatus determines required adjustment parameters in a preceding adjustment process and executes exposures in a subsequent exposure process.
• Adjustment parameters can be modified by spatial position changes of the support plate or connection/disconnection of transmit and receive coils.
• The adjustment parameters are stored until the examination's conclusion and can be reused for identical or similar exposure parameters.
• High-contrast exposures are obtained without omitting adjustments, and reduced examination times result due to quick coil switching and stored adjustment parameters.
• The inventive solution is suitable for various forms of MRI apparatuses, including cylindrical and horseshoe magnets.
</summary>

* The invention provides an apparatus for removing a gas from a liquid using a vessel with multiple gasification chambers, each with a mechanism for ingesting and mixing a second gas to displace the first gas and create a turbulent area.
* The apparatus is particularly suited for use on floating offshore hydrocarbon recovery platforms and has a reduced height compared to stripping towers, resulting in decreased vessel height requirements and reduced capital costs.

• The packaging machine consists of a rotationally driven shaft arranged in the production direction, which drives movable tool members of various work stations through transfer mechanisms, ensuring automatic synchronization of their movements.
• The transfer mechanisms can be toggle levers or cam mechanisms, converting the rotational movement of the shaft into the required movement for the respective tool member, and reducing wear and high forces.
• The packaging machine can have a compact design due to the use of a single shaft driving multiple tool members, and can include a frame to stabilize the shaft and prevent vibrations. Additionally, some work stations can be arranged on different vertical levels for a more compact design.

<summary>

• The text describes a skin reflectance measuring apparatus and its application in pathology and cosmetology.
• The measurement of skin reflectance is useful for studying seborrhea and grading different types of skins.
• Existing methods for measuring surface reflectance are not suitable for measuring skin reflectance due to the influence of color.
• To overcome the effect of color, a relative measurement between specular reflection and diffuse reflection is proposed.
• The apparatus comprises a probe with an aperture, a flexible connection in fiber optics, a measuring device with light emitting and receiving means, and a display device.
• The use of fiber optics and a flexible connection allows for miniaturization, easy handling, and measurement on small surfaces.
• The emitting device regulates the intensity of the emitted light, and the receiving device measures both specular and diffuse reflection.
• The measurement is corrected for variations in light intensity and ambient light using synchronous detection.
• The resulting reflectance value is a relative value, and a scale of reflectance is defined from a measurement of a matt surface and a calibrated mirror.

</summary>

The text describes a skin reflectance measuring apparatus and its application in pathology and cosmetology. The measurement of skin reflectance is useful for studying seborrhea and grading different types of skins. Existing methods for measuring surface reflectance are not suitable for measuring skin reflectance due to the influence of color. To overcome the effect of color, a relative measurement between specular reflection and diffuse reflection is proposed. The apparatus comprises a probe with an aperture, a flexible connection in fiber optics, a measuring device with light emitting and receiving means, and a display device. The use of fiber optics and a flexible connection allows for miniaturization, easy handling, and measurement on small surfaces. The emitting device regulates the intensity of the emitted light, and the receiving device measures both specular and diffuse reflection. The measurement is corrected for variations in light intensity and ambient light using synchronous detection. The resulting reflectance value is a relative value, and a scale of reflectance is defined from a measurement of a matt surface and a calibrated mirror.

<summary>

- The invention relates to methods and apparatus for providing ventilatory assistance matched to a subject's respiratory need, suitable for spontaneously or non-spontaneously breathing human subjects.
- Subjects with severe lung, chest wall, neuromuscular, or respiratory control diseases may require long-term home mechanical ventilation, especially during sleep.
- During sleep, there are changes in neural control of breathing and mechanics of the subject's airways, respiratory muscles, and chest wall, requiring increased ventilatory support.
- Most known ventilators do not accurately match the amplitude and phase of mask pressure to the subject's spontaneous efforts, leading to discomfort or panic and reduced efficiency.
- The invention aims to address goals (i) closely matching the phase and degree of assistance to the subject's spontaneous efforts when ventilation is well above a target ventilation, (ii) automatically adjusting the degree of assistance to maintain at least a specified minimum average ventilation without relying on the subject's chemoreflexes, and damping out instabilities, and (iii) providing some immunity to the effects of sudden leaks.
- The invention discloses a method for calculating the instantaneous phase in the respiratory cycle as a continuous variable using identifiable features of a prototype flow-vs-time waveform and fuzzy logic.
- The method includes selecting at least two identifiable features, determining their phases and assigning weights, defining fuzzy sets for magnitude and rate of change, and applying fuzzy inference rules to determine the instantaneous phase.
- The invention further discloses a method for calculating the average respiratory rate by low pass filtering the instantaneous rate of change of phase.
- The invention seeks to achieve one or more of the above goals and improvements over the prior art.

</summary>

<summary>

- The present invention is a process for installing flat uncontoured glass panels in curved window openings of vehicles, using a phenomenon where the glass panel's urgency to return to its flat shape is used to apply adhesive sealant.
- The method involves placing the flat glass panel in the curved window bay, securing a holding means to engage and maintain the glass, flexing the glass to conform to the bay, and applying weather sealant and adhesive compound along the edges of the panel.
- The holding means consists of resilient clips uniformly spaced around the perimeter of the window bay and a reveal molding secured to the clips, which presses on the outer surface of the glass panel and pushes it into conforming engagement with the bay.
- The glass panel is flexed outwardly against the reveal molding to apply the adhesive sealant into the space between the edge of the glass panel and the window opening.
- The adhesive cures until the panel becomes fixed permanently in the window opening in its conforming curvature.
- The use of flat uncontoured glass panels is more cost-effective than pre-contoured glass, and the method allows for easier installation and packaging.

</summary>

<summary>
• The text describes a disposable finishing article drive member assembly constructed according to the principles of the present invention.
• The assembly includes a grinding wheel with a permanently affixed hub, a backing flange, a retaining nut, and a pressure cap.
• The backing flange has a smaller diameter than the grinding wheel and defines a central aperture aligned with the wheel's aperture.
• The retaining nut is inserted through the wheel and flange, and its end is upset to securely attach the nut and flange together without adhesives.
• The pressure cap snaps into locking engagement with the hub assembly and is retained by gripping means on the flange.
• The assembly provides compressive forces that securely hold the grinding wheel in place during use and prevent it from rotating relative to the hub.
• The assembly is lightweight, vibration-free, and less expensive than prior art throw-away articles while meeting all safety standards.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention is a gate valve designed for controlling bulk dispensing of viscous substances using one hand.
• It consists of a tubular sleeve with a dispensing package and a gate that can be reciprocated by the fingers to control flow.
• The gate and guide are curved complementally transversely to create a seal when the gate is over the discharge outlet.
• The valve can be mounted on the spout of a bag and is easily disassembled for cleaning.
• The valve functions in inclined positions and allows for complete cut-off or gradual flow control.
• The valve can be used in fast-food restaurants and other applications where viscous substances are dispensed.
</summary>

• The invention relates to a steering column for a motor vehicle with a jacket unit and a retaining part.
• The jacket unit is secured non-displaceably to the retaining part up to a limit value of force acting parallel to the longitudinal axis of the steering shaft.
• If the limit value is exceeded, the jacket unit is displaceable parallel to the longitudinal axis in the direction toward the motor vehicle front.
• The jacket unit is connected to the retaining part across an energy absorption connection, which includes at least one bending wire or strip that is deformed upon displacement, and a break-away connection that is closed and blocks displacement up to the limit value, but is released if the limit value is exceeded.
• The invention also covers a method for producing such a steering column.
• Adjustable steering columns are known, some of which are adjustable in length and height or inclination.
• Conventional steering columns have a steering shaft and jacket unit that are displaceable in the longitudinal direction with energy absorption in the event of a crash.
• DE 28 21 707 A1 discloses a non-adjustable steering column with fins that become detached from securement blocks, allowing dislocation of the jacket tube and deformation of U-shaped bending strips.
• EP 0 598 857 B1 discloses an adjustable steering column with bending strips or wires that are deformed during dislocation of the jacket unit.
• The invention addresses the problem of decreasing the force peak during the break-away of the jacket unit from the retaining part by exerting an elastic prestress on the bending wire or strip, which decreases the force required to release the break-away connection.

<summary>
• The text describes a railroad car center plate assembly and a grounding product for its all polymeric type bowl liners.
• Early railroad car liners were made of hard metal alloys like manganese steel, which required frequent lubrication.
• Recent liners are made of ultra high molecular weight polymer, but they are nonconductive and require separate grounding apparatus.
• The invention provides for effective grounding without the use of conductive plates, clips, or shunts attached to the liner.
• The liner material used in the invention has similar mechanical properties to the Chierici and Murphy patent but improved electrical properties.
• The Chierici and Murphy patent discloses a special truck bolster bowl liner made of an ultra high molecular weight polymer of dry self-lubricating characteristics.
• The invention uses a liner composed of a base UHMW-PE material with a conductive material additive, such as carbon black.
• The liner is pliable, non-stretchable, compaction resistant, and has a high degree of elastic memory, making it suitable for railroad car center bowl liners.
</summary>

<summary>

- The present invention describes an anti-lock braking system for motorcycles with an anti-dive device and a damped telescopic front suspension.
- The anti-dive device is responsive to the brake force applied to the front wheel and prevents the front fork from diving during braking, reducing the loss of braking efficiency.
- The anti-dive unit consists of a housing, a valve body, a valve seat, and a valve spring. It is communicated with the lower hydraulic chamber and the hydraulic relay chamber, and the valve body is set on the valve seat when the front master cylinder operates to actuate the front wheel brake.
- The anti-dive unit restricts the contraction of the front fork, allowing the grounding load on the front wheel to increase quickly and minimizing variations in the angular deceleration of the front wheel, improving braking efficiency.

</summary>

<summary>

- The text describes a vehicle rearview mirror system that is tolerant of different protocols of an output from a vehicle control.
- The system includes a mirror control that receives input from the vehicle control and determines the protocol by software processing.
- The input from the vehicle control may be gear status information, engine information, alarm information, or door status information.
- The mirror control may be a microcomputer with non-volatile memory and programming code for a power-up sequence and main sequence.
- The power-up sequence determines the protocol based on the running average of the reverse-gear indication and the ignition-cycle average.
- The main sequence adjusts the running average based on the assumption that the vehicle is more likely to be in a particular state than not.
- The system uses a logical sequence of events to determine the protocol and updates it when the value of the running average reaches an extremely high or low value.
- The system reduces the likelihood of anomalies affecting the performance by utilizing an ignition-cycle average that is only incremented or decremented upon vehicle power-up.

</summary>

<summary>

• The invention is based on a hydraulic unit for a vehicle brake system with a housing block and a motor, both having essential components such as eccentric chambers, pump pistons, and spring chambers.
• Pressure fluid entrained by the pump pistons drips into the spring chambers through first conduit portions, preventing it from reaching electrical components.
• The invention offers cost savings and a hermetic seal from the environment by eliminating the need for permeable elements at a central venting point or check valves.
• The housing block can be produced economically due to fewer conduits and easier cleaning.
• The invention is compatible with existing hydraulic unit designs, allowing the engineer to decide on the size and storage capacity based on the intended use.
• The invasion of water between the container and the housing block is prevented, ensuring the motor's sealing off from the environment.
• A pressure equilibrium is established between the motor and the covering hood, protecting electromagnets and electrically operative components from the harmful effects of the environment.
• The invention uses a cable sheath as a pressure equalization conduit between the ambient atmosphere and the interior of the housing, eliminating the need for a separate pressure equalization hose.
• The invention provides a cost-effective solution for diverting pressure fluid entrained by pump pistons, using conduit portions in two ways for pressure fluid diversion and equalization.
• The invention is not limited to the described exemplary embodiments and can be adapted to various hydraulic unit designs within the spirit and scope of the invention.

</summary>

<summary>

- The present invention relates to a fluid pressure regulator assembly that generates power while regulating fluid pressure.
- It reduces variances in output pressure caused by large differences in input pressure, making it inexpensive to manufacture and maintain.
- The assembly is lightweight and portable, and reduces the size and cost of a regulator needed to regulate fluid pressure.
- The preferred embodiment includes a vane motor that converts fluid pressure into mechanical power, which can be further converted into rotational and/or electrical energy.
- Alternative embodiments include using dual vane motors or a compressor with two vane motors, one for generating electricity and the other for producing mechanical work.

</summary>

<summary>

- The invention relates to a power and free conveyor system where a third dog is provided to enable selective transfer of carriers across short or long distances.
- The third dog is normally held out of operative position by the track but can be moved to operative position as the carrier reaches a transfer zone.
- The second and third dogs have cam projections that engage portions of the track, allowing selective activation of each dog for transfer.
- The system can accommodate various conveyor systems with different transfer distances by using the selectively operable second and third dogs.
- The dogs are held out of operative position by the track using cam projections that engage the dogs, and are moved to operative position as the carrier reaches the transfer zone.
- The system can be modified to accommodate different conveyor configurations and transfer distances by using various track designs and dog configurations.

</summary>

Explanation:
The text describes an invention related to power and free conveyor systems, specifically a system that enables selective transfer of carriers across short or long distances using a third dog. The third dog is normally held out of operative position by the track but can be moved to operative position as the carrier reaches a transfer zone. The second and third dogs have cam projections that engage portions of the track, allowing selective activation of each dog for transfer. The system can accommodate various conveyor systems with different transfer distances by using the selectively operative second and third dogs. The dogs are held out of operative position by the track using cam projections that engage the dogs, and are moved to operative position as the carrier reaches the transfer zone. The text also includes several figures and descriptions of modifications to the system for different conveyor configurations and transfer distances.

<summary>

- The invention features a pallet system with a pallet and a pallet cap, having raised parallel guide rails for supporting trays with side supports.
- The space between each pair of guide rails is substantially open, and the guide rails are raised above the weight bearing area of the pallet.
- The pallet system includes end stops on the top surface of the pallet, end plates for securing the first and second end plates, and end plate holders for securing the end plates.
- The pallet system allows trays to be slid on and off, and is suitable for automated loading and unloading.
- The pallet system restricts both lateral and longitudinal movement of items loaded onto the pallet, providing enhanced stability when loaded and wrapped.
- The invention also includes a stacked pallet with trays stacked in layers on the pallet, and a method of loading a pallet by sliding trays onto the pallet along a pair of guide rails.

</summary>

• The present invention relates to improved gas-liquid contacting trays and valve-tray assemblies, specifically an improved tray valve assembly for a process column where liquid flows downwardly from a downcomer onto a tray and vapor flows upwardly for interaction and mass transfer. The improvement comprises a plurality of apertures formed in the tray having a valve cover mounted thereon, with the first leg being wider than the second leg and disposed to intercept the flow of liquid across the tray.
• The invention also includes the above described tray valve being formed of a round disc having first and second legs in support thereof, with flange portions extending from the disc and engaging the underside of the tray to prevent lifting. The valve aperture is circular in shape and the legs are disposed in slotted regions disposed outwardly of the circular aperture to prevent rotation. The biasing means comprises a detent portion formed on the cover of the valve for preventing the surface thereof from resting flush against the tray surface, facilitating the initial passage of vapor through the valve.

<summary>

- The text describes an invention of a sanitizable rotary valve for use in liquid chromatography systems, specifically for use with liquid chromatographic columns and sanitary liquid handling systems.
- Prior art rotary valves, such as those in U.S. Pat. Nos. 4,808,317, 2,985,589, 3,268,604, and 4,409,033, do not have sanitizable features and require disassembly for cleaning.
- The invention includes a rotary carousel diaphragm valve with a thermoplastic elastomeric diaphragm that is molded to form multiple sealing ports and sanitary elastomeric tubular ducts.
- The valve has a flexible wiping lip seal that maintains fluid-tight sealing engagement with the face of the stator during cross flushing for cleaning.
- The required sealing force is minimized by relieving material from either the surface of the stator or from the rotor diaphragm to form port-sealing ledges and adjoining gutters.
- The invention is directed to a sliding multi-port diaphragm valve and a multi-port sliding valve, both having a linear slider, a stator with connection ports and associated channels, and a sealing means comprising a diaphragm with at least one slider port sealing means and at least one connection port capable of being in fluid communication with a source of SIP fluid.

</summary>

* The present invention is about an electrical driven flying saucer based on magnetic suspension with a compact design, reasonable layout, small weight, and high motive power conversion efficiency.
* The rotary-wing system is a magnetic suspension electromotive rotary-wing system with magnetic suspension rotary-wing wheels suspended on the magnetic suspension shaft using radial and axial magnetic suspension bearings.
* The radial magnetic suspension structure uses repulsive forces between magnets on the rotary-wing wheels and the magnetic suspension shaft or guide rail to suspend the wheels in the radial direction.
* The axial magnetic suspension structure uses repulsive forces between magnets on the rotary-wing wheels and the inner and outer magnetic suspension guide rails to suspend the wheels in the axial direction.
* The electric engine consists of the magnetic suspension rotary-wing wheels, electromotive ring, and magnetic suspension shaft, forming a magnetic suspension electric engine with the electromotive ring controlling the changes of current flowing in it to generate a rotating magnetic field and push the magnetic suspension rotary-wing wheels to rotate.

* The invention describes a process for producing transgenic plants or plant cells transformed on a chromosome with a DNA sequence of interest, capable of expressing a function of interest from said DNA sequence of interest.
* The process involves providing plant cells or plants with at least two different vectors adapted to recombine with each other by site-specific recombination and integrate said DNA sequence of interest into the chromosome.
* The DNA sequence of interest contains sequence portions from at least two of the vectors, necessary for expressing the function of interest.
* The process allows for the assembly of complex DNA sequences in planta prior to integration into plant nuclear DNA, avoiding difficult cloning procedures.
* The invention has applications in functional genomics, gene optimization, and the design of safer vectors for stable nuclear transformation.

• The present invention relates to a swash plate type compressor with a fluorocarbon coating on the swash plate's facial and end surfaces to reduce frictional wear and increase durability.
• The coating is applied as a heat curable, cross-linked coating comprising a polyfluoro elastomer, lubricious additive, and load bearing additive, which is bonded directly to the aluminum swash plate.
• The coating allows the use of low silicon alloy aluminum without the need for metal plating or high finish polishing, and the piston shoe can also be coated for additional low friction properties.
• The coating process does not require the high surface finish or complex electroplating process used in prior swash plate designs, and the coating exhibits high durability and low coefficient of friction.

• The present invention provides novel organic polymers suitable for use in anti-reflective coatings for semiconductor devices, specifically for use in photolithography processes using 193 nm and 248 nm light beams.
• The polymers are designed to facilitate light absorption at wavelengths of 193 nm and 248 nm and can be prepared using reaction equations involving polyhydroxystyrene resin, diazonaphthoquinone halide, and an amine in a solvent. The resulting polymers form a cross-linked structure when coated on a wafer and baked at high temperatures, allowing for the formation of an organic anti-reflective coating material that is spectroscopically stable under conventional photolithographic conditions.

<summary>
• The present invention provides an apparatus and method for continuously conducting an anodic oxidation and an electrolytic coloring of an aluminum strip or wire without requiring a large amount of electrical energy.
• The method involves anodizing the aluminum article in an anodic oxidation bath to form an anodic coating, and then electrolytically coloring the oxide coating in an electrolyte containing a specific acid or water-soluble metal salt.
• The electrolytic coloring bath contains at least one of a nickel salt, a cobalt salt, a copper salt, a tin salt, and selenious acid, and the bath composition is selected based on the desired color.
• The aluminum strip or wire is rendered capable of functioning as a cathode indirectly by the action of the electrode disposed in the bath and is electrolyzed by direct current in the bath.
• The current density and electrolytic period of time in the bath are controlled by the area of the aluminum strip or wire immersed, the amount of electric current applied, and the period of immersion of the aluminum strip or wire.
</summary>

<summary>

- The text describes an improved partition system for dividing cargo areas in refrigerated trailers, railcars, or containers, allowing different temperatures for various zones.
- The partition panels are slidably attached to rails using a trolley assembly, enabling them to be moved fore and aft and raised to the ceiling when not in use.
- The rail system consists of longitudinal rails with internal channels for slidable members, end rails with lift mechanisms and safety chains, and mounting flanges for fastening to the trailer walls or ceiling.
- The trolley assembly includes hinge plates fixed to the panels, hinge rods, and trolleys with rollers for sliding into desired positions.
- The panels are moved by lifting the bottom and securing to the ceiling with a strap and hook, or by using other mounting mechanisms that cooperate with the rails.
- The panels can be modified to provide additional functionalities, such as being replaced with other mounting mechanisms or having different widths.
- The text also mentions that the panels can be used without center partition panels and can be secured relative to one another with various means.

</summary>

The text describes an improved partition system for dividing cargo areas in refrigerated trailers, railcars, or containers, allowing different temperatures for various zones. The partition panels are slidably attached to rails using a trolley assembly, enabling them to be moved fore and aft and raised to the ceiling when not in use. The rail system consists of longitudinal rails with internal channels for slidable members, end rails with lift mechanisms and safety chains, and mounting flanges for fastening to the trailer walls or ceiling. The trolley assembly includes hinge plates fixed to the panels, hinge rods, and trolleys with rollers for sliding into desired positions. The panels are moved by lifting the bottom and securing to the ceiling with a strap and hook, or by using other mounting mechanisms that cooperate with the rails. The panels can be modified to provide additional functionalities, such as being replaced with other mounting mechanisms or having different widths. The text also mentions that the panels can be used without center partition panels and can be secured relative to one another with various means.

* The present invention concerns streptavidin muteins with improved binding affinity for peptide ligands, a process for their production, and their use in the isolation, purification, and determination of biological substances.
* The importance of the biotin/streptavidin system in molecular biology is highlighted, with its specific affinity and stability making it a valuable tool in various applications.
* Conventional methods for utilizing this system require the reagent or enzyme to be obtained in a pure form for biotinylation, but for certain applications, this is not possible or is less convenient.
* To extend the range of application of the biotin/streptavidin system, peptide ligands have been developed that bind to streptavidin with high affinity. These ligands can be coexpressed with the desired protein, allowing for the direct labeling and purification of the protein.
* The present invention optimizes the streptavidin/peptide ligand system by producing streptavidin muteins with increased binding affinity. This is achieved through mutations in the region of amino acid positions 44 to 53 of streptavidin.
* The invention also provides methods for producing these streptavidin muteins, as well as their use in the isolation, purification, and determination of biological substances. The improved binding affinity allows for more efficient and effective use of the streptavidin/peptide ligand system in various applications.

* The invention relates to a white, flame-retardant, UV-resistant, thermoformable, oriented film made from a crystallizable thermoplastic with a thickness of 10-350 μm.
* The film comprises at least one white pigment, one flame retardant, and one UV absorber, and has good orientability and thermoformability, as well as excellent optical and mechanical properties.
* The film can be produced cost-effectively and passes fire tests to DIN 4102 Part 2 and Part 1, and the UL 94 test.
* The film has high UV resistance, meaning it absorbs UV light and does not transmit light until the visible region has been reached.
* The film can be thermoformed without predrying and has excellent stretchability.
* The invention overcomes the shortcomings of previous films, such as inadequate thermoformability, yellowing, and impairment of mechanical properties on outdoor exposure.

* The invention relates to methods of forming substituted guanidines using nickel catalysts.
* Nickel catalysts, preferably in the zero oxidation state, are used to guanylate amines or pyrrolidines with thioureas or isothioureas.
* Suitable Ni(0) catalysts are derived from nickel-boride alloys, nickel-phosphide alloys, aluminum-nickel alloys, nickel on kieselguhr, and nickel on silica/alumina.
* Nickel catalysts are advantageous due to their relatively inexpensive cost and complete recoverability after the guanylation reactions.
* Preferred guanylating agents are thioureas and isothioureas, with at least one of the R groups being a protecting group, such as Boc, Cbz, or arylsulfonyl groups.
* The reactions are carried out at room temperature or under ambient conditions in a solvent system, such as DMF, THF, DMSO, or water.
* The inventive methods result in high yields of substituted guanidines, with at least 85% yield after a reaction time of about 30 minutes with a nickel catalyst and a thiourea as the guanylating agent, and at least 85% yield after a reaction time of about 2 hours with a nickel catalyst and an isothiourea as the guanylating agent.

• The present invention relates to a method and apparatus for forming bias laid, non-woven fabrics with yarns in at least two layers laid at an angle to the long axis of the fabric. The yarns are held together by stitching or other external means.
• The invention provides a rake mechanism synchronized with, but driven separately from, the conveyors, yarn carrying means, and bonding mechanism, which accepts and retains yarns being carried by the yarn carrying means at the ends of their travel, allowing for greater assurance of parallelism and overlapping of successive courses for better control of strength and thickness.

• The present invention provides a new process for manufacturing 143a (1,1,1-trifluoroethane) using continuous gas phase hydrofluorination with heterogeneous catalysis.
• The process uses 1,1-difluoro-1-chloroethane (142b) as the organic feed and hydrofluoric acid (HF) as the fluorinating agent.
• The catalyst used in the process is a chromium salt, which may be unsupported or supported, and optionally includes a cocatalyst such as nickel, cobalt, or manganese salts.
• The process runs at a temperature between 30° C. and 400° C., preferably between 30° and 280° C., and at a pressure between 1 atmosphere (0 psig) and 200 psig.
• The process avoids the formation of unwanted olefinic byproducts by maintaining a high HF/142b molar ratio, which is affected by the reaction temperature.

* The present invention relates to a process for spinning and making bast fibre yarn, specifically twice health-preserved bast fibres and blended spinning bast fibres and other fibres, to improve flexibility and reduce end breakage rate.
* The process involves health preserving bast fibres, opening, cleaning, and carding, health preserving bast fibre strips, and spinning health preserved bast fibre strips into bast fibre yarn. The temperature, humidity, and duration of health preserving can vary.
* The invention has been tested with jute, kenaf, hemp, linen, and a combination of jute and kenaf fibres, resulting in reduced end breakage rates compared to existing technologies.

• The invention relates to a method and apparatus for forming fiber mixtures from multiple fiber types by sequentially removing partial quantities from individual fiber bales.
• The method involves measuring the entire momentary quantity of each fiber bale before each pass and determining a partial quantity corresponding to a predetermined proportion.
• Only the calculated partial quantity is removed from the measured fiber bale during each pass.
• The partial quantities are taken off the fiber bales in sequence in a predetermined number of passes.
• The method ensures that all fiber bales are opened without fiber residuals and enables the formation of an optimally homogeneous mixture.
• The method sets a predetermined period for the removal of partial quantities from each fiber bale to maintain a determined time schedule and prevent idle run of processing machines.
• The apparatus includes a bale opener, a quantity measuring device, and a control device that determines the precise partial quantities to be removed and controls the fiber removing operation.
• The control device may include a timer that predetermines a maximum period to ensure that the partial quantity from each stored fiber lot is removed not later than at the end of the predetermined period.

• The invention relates to an improved process for the deacylation and desulfurization of a compound having the formula: ##STR3##
• The process uses hypophosphorous acid to improve product yield and reduce impurities.
• Pyrazolotriazoles, useful magenta couplers for photographic products, are difficult to synthesize and have limited synthetic routes.
• The preferred synthetic route involves preparation of triazolothiadiazines and their desulfurization to pyrazolotriazoles.
• The desulfurization process generates unwanted impurities, including thione and disulfide, which can interfere with subsequent reaction steps and are detrimental in photographic systems.
• Hypophosphorous acid reduces the amount of these impurities and increases the yield of the desired product.
• The process generates hydrogen sulfide as a by-product instead of sulfur, which is readily removed from the reaction zone.
• The process is straightforward and economical to carry out, making it readily adaptable by industry.
• The invention provides two preferred embodiments for the preparation of 3,6-di-substituted-1H-pyrazolo[5,1-c]-1,2,4-triazoles using hypophosphorous acid.

<summary>
• The present invention relates to a method and apparatus for inserting different weft threads in a multiple-color air jet loom with varying weft carrying forces.
• In prior looms, air under uniform pressure is ejected from groups of main nozzles and subnozzles, resulting in constant weft carrying forces and varying weft thread speeds.
• The present invention achieves stable weft thread insertion and prevents undue consumption of pressurized air by ejecting air under different pressures or for different intervals of time from main nozzle units or subnozzles.
• Different weft carrying forces can be produced by varying the interval of time or air ejecting forces, which are produced by a combination of factors such as subnozzle pitches, nozzle orifice areas, nozzle distances from the warp shed, nozzle angles, and pressure.
• The on-off valves can be selectively actuated by mechanical or electrical means in synchronism with the loom operation to control the air supply to the main nozzle and subnozzles for inserting different weft threads.
</summary>

• The text describes a dry cleaning machine with an air flow system for inducing ambient air into the access opening whenever the door is opened, while minimizing the exhausting of residual solvent vapors from the tubs.
• The system includes a separate intake fan and duct with a valve that opens when the door is opened, allowing air to be drawn into the access opening and directly into the interposed duct, while minimizing the loss of solvent vapors from the tubs.

• The present invention relates to an automatic quilting machine with separate computers or process controllers to control the sewing machine functions and the frame table movements independently, allowing for easier reprogramming of each function.
• The system includes a frame quilting machine with a large metal frame, a sewing machine head, and a reprogrammable function for tracing and duplicating patterns using a computer aided design program. The sewing machine function is controlled by one computer, and the quilting table movement in the X-direction, Y-direction, and X-Y direction is controlled by a separate computer.

• The text describes a sewing machine that uses ultrasonic waves to detect the position of a marker on a work cloth, eliminating the need for physical markers.
• The machine includes a receiver that detects the ultrasonic waves and a CPU that calculates the position of the marker based on the detection timing of the receiver.
• The receiver can be provided on the sewing machine itself or on an embroidery unit that can be attached to the machine.
• The ultrasonic pen used to mark the position on the work cloth can be connected to the machine via a cable or can output electromagnetic waves that are detected by the machine.

* The invention is an apparatus for an ironing board that includes a clamp, a flexible cord support, and a detachable article holder.
* The clamp, in the shape of a "C", secures to the ironing board with a movable jaw and adjusting screw. The flexible cord support pivots and is held in place by a detent on the brace.
* The article holder has a circular base and hoops, with tangs that detachably attach to the clamp. It can hold items like cans or bottles.
* The apparatus can be disassembled for storage, with the cord support retracting and the article holder detaching from the clamp.

<summary>
• The invention relates to a buttonhole controlling device for a sewing machine that can produce neat buttonholes in various materials.
• The device includes a foot pad, a travelling assembly with a slidable member, and an adjustable stop.
• The slidable member carries a tab to actuate a tripping lever on the machine, limiting the length of the buttonhole formed.
• The adjustable stop engages the tripping lever to terminate buttonhole formation, allowing the operator to precisely define the closure point.
• The operator positions the button between "V" notches on the device to establish the buttonhole length.
• The device can be adjusted for different materials by readjusting the screw while working with a sample of the new material.
</summary>

* The present invention relates to methods and preparations for enhancing the utility of cellulosic fabric materials, specifically cotton, linen, or other natural fibers, by adding functional additives.
* One aspect of the invention uses ultrafine wool powder as a carrier for functional additives, which demonstrates exceptional carrying and retention capability, improving the durability of functional enhancements.
* Another aspect of the invention uses ultrafine bamboo powder as a functional additive, which has good moisture management properties.
* The preparations are made by pulverizing the wool or bamboo fibers into ultrafine powder, forming a suspension, and adding functional additives and binders. The preparations can be applied to the cellulosic fabric materials by printing, padding, or foam application.

* The present invention introduces a new method and apparatus for forming fine continuous filaments, specifically melt spun nonwoven webs, using an initial quench chamber and a continuous two-dimensional slot across the entire machine width.
* This design allows for good control of cross-machine uniformity, as the linear plane of filaments has substantially constant filament distribution, and the process equipment is simpler compared to both eductive and non-eductive systems.
* The system uses the same air for quenching and drawing the filaments, resulting in higher quench pressures without structural deflection problems, and a smaller drawing chamber with minimal nozzle length parallel to the fiber/air stream. This leads to higher pressures and better mixing, producing very high air and fiber velocities and improved web formation control.

* The present invention provides apparatus and methods for accurately detecting, measuring, and partially removing rotational variability effects from a covered roll used in nip presses, allowing for a more accurate display of the nip pressure profile.
* The invention uses multiple sensors circumferentially spaced at various cross-directional positions along the sensing roll to cancel rotational variability and obtain a more true measurement of the pressure distribution across the nip region. Strategically-placed sensors measure the pressure being placed against the web, and the average of measurements of two or more sensors spaced apart at a cross-directional position provides a good measurement of the actual pressure being developed and cancels rotational variability of 1 times the rotational frequency. Similarly, the average of measurements of three or four sensors spaced apart at a cross-directional position cancels rotational variability of 2 times the rotational frequency. Information on higher frequency barring which is indicative of cover wear can be obtained by spacing the sensing elements at different rotational positions. The difference between individual sensing elements and the average of the group of sensing elements at the same cross-direction progression provides a measure of the roundness of the roll and shape of the cover, with the progression of this difference as the cover ages an indicator of cover wear.

<summary>
• The text describes a flexible traction element made of stranded cables sheathed in a thermoplastic plastics material.
• The production line for making this traction element includes unwinding reels, orientation devices, heating, extrusion, cooling, and cutting.
• The stranded cables are cleaned, oriented, and preheated before being sheathed in the plastics material.
• The extruder has a thread guide and adjustable matrix to precisely position the stranded cables in the plastics material jacket.
• The traction element is cooled and wound onto a storage roller after being cut to length.
</summary>

* The invention describes a device for feeding and sewing a strip of material onto a cut of fabric using a sewing machine. The device includes a control setup with a stop that can be moved into the feed path of the strip and actuated by the strip to control the sewing machine's operation.
* The stop is mounted on a two-armed lever that is part of a control means, including a control switch and a setting means for adjusting the position of the stop. The lever can be moved into a position to actuate the signal transmitter independently of the strip.
* The stop is also mounted for being displaced by a setting means, such as an air cylinder, and is biased by a spring to ensure proper positioning and movement. The device ensures continuous operation and is insensitive to disturbances, making it suitable for sewing relatively stiff strips of material.

* The text describes an apparatus for treating a dyed or printed textile web with a liquid, which includes a conveyor, a liquid applicator, a suction device, and a dwell stretch.
* The conveyor is an endless sieve belt for transporting the textile web along a predetermined horizontal path. The liquid applicator is disposed at a first station along the path for applying the liquid to the web during motion. The suction device is disposed at a second station along the path for removing the liquid from the web by suction during motion. The dwell stretch is disposed between the applicator and the suction device for conducting the textile web in a spread-out condition and in a single layer through at least one dwell loop.
* The action time of the applied liquid on the substances to be removed from the fabric or textile web is lengthened, resulting in improved washing effect and maintaining tension at a small level. The apparatus is especially advantageous for treating printed material without soiling a white background.
* The apparatus can have a compact construction, with the textile web guided back to the sieve belt at a point downstream and closely adjacent to the point where it leaves the belt. The suction device is disposed near the point of return of the web to the sieve belt, causing it to adhere to the belt and be entrained by it.

<summary>
• The invention relates to a new rotary hook arrangement for a lockstitch sewing machine.
• The holding means which prevent co-rotation and reverse rotation of the bobbin housing are arranged to hinder the guiding of the needle thread loop as little as possible.
• The needle thread loop can be expanded totally unhindered until its maximum expansion is reached, and then pulled back by the thread take-up lever without touching the front cam.
• A capsule release device can give the bobbin housing a rotational impulse counter to the direction of hook rotation, eliminating the slight impediment of the thread movement caused by the bending of the spring rod.
• The design is simple, rugged, and economical to manufacture.
• The rotary hook is outstanding for an especially jerk-free and low friction motion of the needle thread loop.
</summary>

<summary>

- The present invention relates to a method of forming a two-sided nonwoven fabric with a pronounced three-dimensional image that is durable to both converting and end-use applications.
- The fabric is formed from a first precursor web and a second precursor web, with a fluid-pervious support layer or scrim interposed between them.
- The precursor webs are hydroentangled on a moveable imaging surface of a three-dimensional image transfer device, resulting in a three-dimensional image that is durable to abrasion and distortion due to elongation.
- The first and second fibrous matrices used in the precursor webs can be dissimilar, and the first and second sides of the fabric are separated by an intermediate water-pervious, fiber distribution control layer.
- The fabric may include apertures that extend partially or entirely through one or more of the component layers.
- The fibrous constituent of the first precursor web and the second precursor web exhibit a fiber modulus difference of at least 10%, with the fibrous matrix with the lower fiber modulus coming in contact with the three-dimensional imaging transfer device.
- The fabric may be subjected to post-entanglement treatments, such as application of a polymeric binder composition, mechanical compacting, application of surfactant or electrostatic compositions, and like processes.
- The precursor webs may be pre-entangled on a foraminous surface prior to hydroentangling on the image transfer device.
- The fabric may be utilized in various applications, including home cleaning, personal hygiene, medical, and industrial uses.

</summary>

• The present invention relates to a load-limiting device for braced frames that can plastically deform during a dynamic event to dissipate energy and preserve the structure from extensive damage.
• The load-limiting device may be easily removed and replaced after plastic deformation with another non-plastically deformed device.
• The device may be attached to a brace in a braced frame structure using a connection means and may provide biaxial support for the frame.
• The load-limiting device may be made of a plastic or metal-based elasto-plastic material and may have a plurality of connection points for attachment to a typical braced frame.

<summary>

- The invention relates to a connective knitting method for joining two tape-shaped knit pieces using a flat knitting machine.
- The method involves knitting two tape-shaped pieces with a boundary between them on either front or rear needle beds.
- When both pieces reach a specified length, the loop portion of the moving side knit fabric is transferred to the needles of the other needle bed and overlaid with the loop of the fixed side knit fabric.
- A new loop is formed on the overlaid part, decreasing one loop in the moving side knit fabric.
- This process is repeated, decreasing more loops in both the moving and fixed side knit fabrics.
- The end parts of both knit fabrics are eventually joined and the final end portion is prevented from loosening.
- The knitting machine used is a flat knitting machine with multiple needles on needle beds that can move and slide back and forth.
- The method can be used in various parts of garments, such as the collar of a sweater, neck rope portion of a tanktop, lower end portion of baseball stockings, and neck rope portion of an apron.
- The two pieces of knit fabric are knitted together and the transfers are carried out by a controlled computer following a designed knitting pattern.
- The method improves productivity and reduces manufacturing cost compared to sewing methods.

</summary>

* The present invention relates to a process for the continuous production of viscose rayon yarns with a high degree of whiteness.
* The process simplifies the traditional method by reducing the number of treatments and accelerating the process without sacrificing the degree of white.
* The process includes the completion of coagulation, washing with non-alkaline water, drying, and possibly finishing.
* The completion of coagulation can be achieved through various methods, including passing time, acid treatment, or a combination of both.
* The wash water used in the process should have a pH between 4.0 and 5.5 and be free from cations in excess amounts.
* The process produces a finished yarn with a high degree of white through partial coagulation and drawing, completion of coagulation, washing, drying, and possibly finishing.

* The present invention relates to a portable and simple guard rail system for use in construction sites to prevent accidental falls and meet safety guidelines.
* The system includes a guard rail support with a flat bottomed base plate, an upright column, guard rail support brackets, a kick board retaining flange, an angular brace, and a safety tie-off ring. The guard rail supports can be used with concrete-filled steel bases for anchoring to floors or ground surfaces, and can be assembled and disassembled efficiently.

<summary>
• The present invention relates to a bedroom cabinet with external surfaces formed to be flat and the ability to accommodate shelves and devices without projection.
• The bedroom cabinet consists of an outer casing and an inner casing, allowing for the formation of boxes or shelves within the clearance between the two.
• The bedroom cabinet provides natural ventilation and increased sound-proofing through the use of spacer members with venting grooves.
• The bedroom cabinet can be stacked or installed adjacent to each other due to its flat external surfaces.
• The bedroom cabinet can be formed from a fiber reinforced plastic or similar material and is internally provided with an inner casing consisting of six panels.
</summary>

<summary>

- The present invention is about a tension control arrangement for a spool creel with multiple spool holders.
- Each spool holder has a tensioning lever, a brake rotor (drum or disc), and an adjustable, tension responsive braking element.
- The tensioning lever has a roller that engages and is biased by the threads, and a biasing arrangement (piston/cylinder assembly) that is activated by fluid pressure.
- The tensioning lever occupies an angular position dependent upon thread tension and weight.
- The biasing arrangement operates in addition to the weight force on the tensioning lever, altering the thread tension.
- The fluid pressure is controllable in common for all the biasing arrangements, allowing for central thread tension determination for the entire creel.
- When the warping machine is shut off, the braking force throughout the entire creel can be increased for quick braking.
- The biasing arrangement uses a piston/cylinder assembly that can follow the swinging movement of the tensioning lever and prevent thread contamination.
- The tensioning lever subtends an angle of more than 45° to the horizontal plane, and the working elevation angle of the biasing arrangement attached to the tensioning lever is less than 45°.
- The biasing arrangement can also operate on a brake shoe that is applied to a further rotating braking surface under higher fluid pressures for rapid braking at shut down.

</summary>

* The text describes a new composite material concept called BTR (biomimetic tendon-reinforced) composite, which was obtained through a topology optimization process to maximize out-plane stiffness.
* The BTR composite structure includes six fundamental components: tendons/muscles, ribs/bones, joints, flesh, skins, and shell. The fibers are evenly distributed in the matrix material, and materials in tension and compression can be treated differently.
* The BTR composite can be extended to a three-dimensional lattice structure, which can be fabricated using bent-wire tendon elements and elongated panel stuffer members. The structure can be made of various raw materials, including steel, carbon-fiber ropes, and carbon fiber/epoxy cover panels.
* The BTR composite has advantages such as the use of embedded fiber tendons, which can act as safety members when a load-carrying tendon breaks. The structure can also be stacked together for even better out-of-plane performance.

• The present invention relates to methods and materials for producing silicon-based micro and nanofibers using electrospinning techniques.
• Liquid silanes, such as cyclohexasilane (Si 6 H 12 ), are used as precursors in the fabrication of electronic materials.
• Electrospinning is a continuous nanofabrication technique capable of producing nanowires of various materials, including silicon, with diameters ranging from 1 nm to 2000 nm.
• Needleless electrospinning has been developed, enabling roll-to-roll manufacturing processes.
• The liquid silane monomers used in the invention are relatively unaffected by the high-voltage electrospinning process and remain associated with the polymeric carrier upon evaporation of the solvent.
• The structure of the silicon nanowires prepared from Si 6 H 12 /polymer carrier in toluene mixtures is governed by the physics of the copolymer mixtures.
• Four-component and five-component inks, consisting of a liquid silane, a polymer, an accelerant, and a solvent or a solid phase, respectively, are useful in the electrospinning procedures.
• The solid phase components can be metallic particles, semiconducting particles, or polydihydrosilane, and the solid phase can also include metal reagents for forming metal silicide wires.
• The electrospun deposits can be transformed into amorphous or crystalline silicon materials through thermal processing or laser processing.

<summary>
• The present invention relates to a sewing machine detector that detects the position of a sewing needle and the speed of a sewing machine.
• The detector is integral with the drive and control elements of the sewing machine.
• The conventional sewing machine drive system includes a sewing machine, motor, belt for transmission of rotation, needle section, control circuit section, detector, and power indicating light.
• The conventional needle position detector includes a detecting section, optical fiber cable, photoelectric translation processing module section, and electrical connectors.
• The reflective discs in the conventional detector must withstand constant vibration during sewing machine operation and maintain precise optical axes with the optical fibers.
• The present invention uses flat, sheet-shaped light shielding discs that detect sewing machine speed, needle UP position, needle DOWN position, and thread trimmer timing position.
• The optical fiber supporter includes two identical pieces with linear optical fiber fixing holes and first and second reflecting portions that ensure accurate optical axes and reduce stress in the optical fibers.
• The light transmitted from the light sending optical fibers is reflected by the first reflecting portions, passes through the light shielding discs, and is reflected by the second reflecting portions to enter the light receiving optical fibers.
• The detector provides accurate and stable operation by integrally securing and fixing the light sending optical fibers, first reflecting portions, second reflecting portions, and light receiving optical fibers in position by the optical fiber supporter.
• The present invention eliminates the need for curved reflecting portions, reducing manufacturing costs and resulting in a thinner, more compact detecting section.
</summary>

<summary>
• The text describes a patent application for a small deaeration tank for use in the pulp and paper industry.
• The tank is designed to deaerate pulp that has been treated with oxygen before washing.
• The tank is preferably the same diameter as an oxygen reactor and has no moving parts.
• The tank has an inlet pipe, an outlet, and a tangential swirl inducing inlet pipe.
• The swirl inducing fluid is the filtrate from the washer after the oxygen bleach.
• The tank can be at atmospheric pressure, under low pressure, or vacuum.
• The tank is cylindrical with an open top and a flat bottom, and its diameter is normally the same size as the diameter of the oxygen reactor.
• The inlet pipe allows the pulp to enter the tank above the surface of the slurry and splash against the side wall.
• The height of the slurry in the tank is controlled by a height sensor at the bottom, which operates a valve to control the flow in the outlet pipe to the washer.
</summary>

* The present invention relates to a plow blade with a fluid passageway and points of fluid ejection, produced using basic manufacturing processes.
* The blade includes a multiple component assembly, allowing for rebuilding by replacing worn portions, and a process for ejecting specific fluids at controlled points along the blade to maximize desired characteristics while minimizing volume.

* The text describes various embodiments of geological formation pressure sensing systems that accurately measure formation pressures at desired depths by isolating the inlet to the pressure sensing apparatus to pressures produced by the formation at such depth.
* The methods involve cementing a conduit with a filter at its bottom end in the borehole at a desired location, pressurizing the conduit to clear it of cement grout, and forming a fluid connection between the formation and the filter to measure the formation pressure.

<summary>

• The text describes a system and method for extending the length of a soil reinforcing element using a splice and a grid-strip.
• The splice includes wave plates with transverse protrusions to seat transverse wires from the soil reinforcing element and the grid-strip.
• The plates define perforations for a connective device to couple the plates together and clamp down on the longitudinal wires of the soil reinforcing element and the grid-strip.
• The transverse wires are prevented from longitudinally escaping the splice once it is secured.
• Multiple splices and grid-strips can be used to extend the length of a single soil reinforcing element and create a composite soil reinforcing element.
• The disclosure provides a basis for designing or modifying other processes and structures for achieving the same purposes and advantages.

</summary>

* The present invention relates to a lock device for preventing a work machine's boom of a construction machine from being tilted by its own weight.
* The lock device includes an engaging member and an engaged member, allowing manual locking and unlocking.
* The guide member is provided on the boom and does not become horizontal while the boom is rotated, ensuring the engaging member maintains the lock position.
* The engaging member is provided with upper and lower guide members, allowing it to be guided at its upper and lower sides, stabilizing the guide of the engaging member and dispersing force applied on the guide member.

<summary>

- The invention describes a new and improved safe and door structure with a rectangular valuables receiving chamber and a separate steel door with inwardly extending ledges and grooves for retaining the door.
- The door is laterally displaced until it is seated in the shallower groove, while the lock assembly on the reverse side of the door prevents lateral movement and reinforcing bolts prevent transmission of force to the lock mechanism in case of intrusion attempts.
