- The safe can be formed using a liner and concrete or all metal construction, and the grooves can be formed by elongate bar members or within the walls themselves.
- The invention provides a simple, yet effective door and safe construction, which can be equally applicable to a basic steel safe, and various adaptations and modifications can be made within the spirit and scope of the invention.

</summary>

• The present invention relates to a swimming pool vacuum cleaner with an adjustable suction head that enables precise regulation of suction efficiency during pool cleaning.
• The adjustment mechanisms are located on the top of the vacuum head and can be quickly operated by hand without the need for hand tools.
• The suction exerted by the vacuum head can be precisely regulated without the need for regulation of the remotely located suction source.
• The invention includes adjustment mechanisms in kit form that can be interconnected with certain types of existing, prior art pool cleaning devices without major retrofit.
• The adjustment mechanism is simple, easy to use, easy to connect to existing devices, and can be manufactured inexpensively.

<summary>
• The present invention relates to a jointing structure in vehicle traveling path joints and the like having an expansion function, which prevents tire fall-in and/or stuck-in situations, ensures high slip resistance to tires, and is easy to maintain.
• The jointing structure includes more than one step provided face to face at the coaxially built traveling path ends with an expansion gap between, more than one elastic member respectively mounted inside the steps, and a joint block mounted on the elastic members across the expansion gap.
• The joint block is placed across the expansion gap, allowing for accurate management of the traveling path surface and preventing differences in level from occurring.
• The elastic members are made of laminated rubber, which is hard to be deformed vertically and easy to be deformed horizontally in a soft manner, and are fitted to the joint block and steps detachably by bolting or the like for easy maintenance.
• The use of a joint block, supporting blocks, and intermediate joint blocks made of the same concrete as the traveling path or high-strength fiber-reinforced concrete eliminates the need for emergency measures involving steel sheets and simplifies difference-in-level management.
</summary>

<summary>

- The present invention relates to a building system that allows for larger and non-square or non-rectangular panels in stucco type cavity wall construction without movement control joints.
- The system caters to panels of greater height (up to 4.85 meters) and width (up to 12 meters) without mandatory movement control joints.
- The wall has a frame or substructure, battens, inner and outer meshes, and a plaster matrix applied as more than one layer.
- The wall has at least one opening, and the periphery of each opening within the matrix is further reinforced with mesh and/or lattice-work at corners, vertical sides, and between adjacent openings.
- The studs are of minimum cross-section (45 mm×90 mm), and the battens are of nominal 35 mm×40 mm cross-section.
- The second mesh is non-metallic, and regional reinforcement is by or includes metallic mesh or a non-metallic sheet material able to be embedded and penetrated by the matrix material.
- Panel boundaries include at least partially embedded lattice-like periphery defining members.
- The aim of the invention is to provide a useful choice for the public in terms of building and building systems, related assemblies, subassemblies, procedures, methods, panels, flashings, reinforcements, and cavity walls of part stucco construction.

</summary>

• The text describes an invention for a mechanism to install and remove objects in wells, including stuck or lost objects.
• The mechanism includes an external overshot or an internal spear, which can be used in wire line service operations or other service operations.
• The tool structure consists of an outer tubular body with an inner body structure that moves into gripping relationship with the object to be removed.
• The tool is locked and unlocked using a catch mechanism with a locking position and an unlocking position, allowing for easy disconnection if necessary.

<summary>
• The present invention relates to a floor transport system for use in a fluid treatment chamber to prevent contamination of the treatment fluid by truck wheels.
• One embodiment includes a wheel channel with opposed sidewalls, one extending upwardly more than the other, and a cover plate horizontally overlying the top of the channel.
• The vertical space between the shorter sidewall and the cover plate accommodates the axle structure connecting the truck frame to the wheel.
• The overlying cover plate can be pivoted away from the wheel channel for cleaning.
• Another embodiment structures the track system to accommodate trucks with downwardly depending struts, with sidewalls extending upwardly beyond the top of the wheel structure and inflatable elastomer seals attached along the length of the sidewall top edges.
• These seals enclose around the hand truck wheel struts and prevent entry of the brine solution into the guide track.
• The enclosed floor track system prevents showered or dripping brine from entering the track system and drains away any contaminated solution separately.
• The system is well adapted for use with horizontally axled hand trucks and hand trucks with depending I-beam struts.
• The enclosed floor tracks enhance the recovery and reuse of the brine solution, preserving natural resources and achieving economic advantages.
• The invention fulfills the need for an enclosed floor track system to prevent corrosion, deterioration of wheels, and contamination of the brine solution.
</summary>

<summary>

- The present invention pertains to a method and apparatus for enhancing oil production from oil-bearing soils and rock formations using pulsed power electrohydraulic and electromagnetic discharges.
- The invention aims to increase the estimated ultimate recovery from reservoirs by causing oil flow to be enhanced.
- The stimulation of crude oil reservoirs to enhance production is a major goal in the petroleum industry, with approximately 66% of discovered oil left in the ground due to lack of effective extraction technology.
- Existing methods rely on injection of fluids into one well and use of the injected fluid to flush hydrocarbons out of the formation to a producing well. However, once the injected fluid attains a continuous phase between the injection and production wells, efficiency drops significantly.
- The invention uses pulsed power electrohydraulic and electromagnetic discharges to generate acoustic and coupled electromagnetic-acoustic vibrations that can cause oil flow to be enhanced.
- The invention addresses the problem of driving out residual oil by using electrical and heating methods, mechanical fracturing, and vibratory or sonic waves, possibly in conjunction with other methods.
- The invention builds on the teachings of U.S. Pat. No. 4,345,650, which uses an electrohydraulic spark discharge to generate a shock and acoustic wave in a producing formation.
- The invention uses pulsed power to generate high-frequency acoustic stimulation of the reservoir separately from the direct acoustic response of the EH shock wave, which can stimulate the reservoir at multiple scales and extend the effective range of the stimulation.
- The invention also includes improvements in the design of the tool, such as the use of processors instead of electronic circuitry, and the use of multiple levels of energy stimulation into the formation.

</summary>

<summary>

- The present invention relates to systems and methods for producing or delivering heat at or near the down hole end of production tubing in oil and gas wells to improve production.
- Existing down hole heating systems have shortcomings, including lack of proper focus on the production zone and inadequate protection for electrical components from chemical or physical attack.
- The present invention addresses these issues by designing the heating unit to contain heat within the production zone and shielding the electrical connections from down hole fluids.
- The heating unit includes electrical resistance type heater rods, cement block encasement, and a steel fitting assembly to protect the electrical connections.
- The method of use involves installing the heating unit with heat-retaining elements to focus heat on the production zone.
- The method can also be used by substituting cable for the down hole pipe during well treatments or maintenance.

</summary>

<summary>

- The text describes a vibratory tool for downhole use that allows a wireline or other tools to pass through a central passage, which can be closed by landing a plug on a seat.
- The dump valve is annularly disposed about the central passage to prevent it from being slammed against a seat during operation.
- The tool has a modular piston stack that can be used to increase the power delivered to the stuck fish by stacking more pistons.
- The plug is retrievable and has a seal to help close off the passage and build pressure in it.
- The valve is cylindrically shaped with a seal ring that moves between surfaces to close and open the valve.
- The tool can be operated to deliver high amplitude low frequency oscillating forces to the stuck fish without impacts on the housing.
- The design eliminates significant cyclical impacts on the valve and allows the mandrel to continue moving downhole after the valve opens.
- The modular design allows the tool to be matched to the power required for the particular work string or downhole conditions.
- The tool can have a rotational lock for torque transmission.
- The text emphasizes the advantages of the present invention, including increased reliability, improved power delivery, and elimination of significant cyclical impacts.

</summary>

<summary>

- The present invention provides a retaining wall system with precast concrete face panels and bases, featuring integral counterforts and a connection method using rebars and grout.
- The counterforts extend perpendicularly from the face panels and have openings for drainage. They also have rebars for additional strength and can be designed with various shapes and sizes.
- The base is a rectangular or trapezoidal shaped platform, precast and solid, with openings to accept downward-extending rebar ends from the counterforts. The connection between the counterfort and base is made by inserting the rebar into the opening and filling it with grout.
- The system allows for flexibility in height and width, and can be customized to various sizes. It also eliminates the need for temporary shoring during installation.
- The retaining wall system can be used in various applications, including retaining soil or other materials, and can be installed adjacent to each other with shear keys or ship laps. Additional features include textured bases, H-piles for added stability, and cast-in-place vehicle impact barriers.
</summary>

<summary>

- The present invention relates to an apparatus for retrieving a wear bushing from around the interior of a well head and casing.
- Wear bushings are used to protect against excessive wear and prevent damage to seal areas of casing heads and other well head elements.
- In some cases, it is necessary to retrieve the wear bushing without the use of the drill bit, such as when the drill pipe is lodged.
- One method for removing the wear bushing involves using a retriever body with dowels or protruding members that engage a J-slot on the wear bushing.
- However, this method requires the retriever body to be secured in rigid engagement with the exterior of the pipe, which can limit its usefulness.
- The present invention provides a retrieving tool that is removably securable on the exterior surface of a sub-unit, allowing it to be mounted on a string of drill pipe independently of threading on the pipe.
- The apparatus includes a sub-unit with a mandrel, a threadably removable lower collar section, and a retriever section with protruding members that engage the extended J-slot of the wear bushing.
- The retriever section is slidably engaged into the double grooved mandrel portion of the sub-unit and prevented from rotating around the mandrel due to engagement with insertion members in the grooves.
- The apparatus allows for vertical movement of the retrieving unit yet rotational movement during operation, preventing damage to the retriever unit or the wear bushing.
- The apparatus can be threadably engaged between any two sections of drill pipe without retrieval of the drill bit from the hole and is easily removable and installable for quick wear bushing replacement.

</summary>

<summary>

• The present application relates to stave floors, specifically modular composed stave floors.
• Conventional stave floors have drawbacks such as thin sight substrate (2-3 mm) and base substrate made of glued sheets.
• Thin sight substrate warms up and deforms during sanding or maintenance, affecting appearance.
• Base substrate and sight substrate can suffer displacement or dimensional changes during assembly.
• Long cure time required for glue to harden.
• Composed stave floors have short life due to thin sight substrate and poor resistance to scratches or peeling.
• Previous attempts to prevent displacement or dimensional changes were not optimal.
• The present invention provides a method for manufacturing composed stave floors with a sight substrate of at least 4 mm thickness and a base substrate of at least 12 mm thickness.
• Multidirectional holding means, including dendrites, glue, clamps, and reinforcement means, are used to assemble the base and sight substrates without displacement or dimensional changes.
• The floors have improved durability and allow for corrective maintenance.

</summary>

<summary>
• The present invention is a ladder attachment designed to improve lateral stability, prevent sliding, and increase contact area with the work surface without defacing it.
• It consists of a brace for a ladder with first and second siderails connected by a rung, having an extension arm with a flange and opening for a U-bolt and ladder rung.
• A resilient pad assembly is pivotally connected to the extension arm to provide a non-slip gripping portion.
• The brace assembly can be used on either siderail and is interchangeable.
• The arm and flange are preferably made of a strong, durable material, and the flange has openings for the U-bolt to encircle the rung.
• The clamp secures the arm to the siderail and can be adjusted to accommodate different ladder sizes. An alternative embodiment allows the pad assembly to pivot horizontally to straddle corners.
</summary>

* The present invention provides a system for controlling the fuel delivery system of a vehicle, allowing for both automatic and manual control of the throttle valve.
* During manual control, the throttle valve is connected directly to the accelerator pedal through a clutch, giving the driver full control of the vehicle.
* The system can be used in conjunction with a continuously variable transmission, automatically switching to the optimum control mode for the throttle based on the transmission ratio.

<summary>
• The text describes a position sensor system that uses a waveform generator and an error correction generator to modify the sensing signal and provide it to a remote monitor via two wires.
• The error correction generator determines and eliminates strong static signals and error signals that do not deliver information about the position of an object being sensed.
• The system includes a window reference circuit that constantly compares the ideal sensor output to the existing sensor output and adjusts it if necessary.
• The sensor draws a minimum of current upon power-up and can be recalibrated at any time by removing and reapplying power.
• The system uses a differential amplifier to modify the unconditioned sensing signal and a counter and digital-to-analog converter to provide the error correction signal.
• The sensor is most desirable for multiplexing with other sensors due to the minimum number of wires required for power and signal transmission.
</summary>

* The present invention provides an efficient apparatus for cooling air through an evaporative refrigeration system, utilizing a heat exchanger that separates dry and wet sides, keeping evaporating water separate from the useful air, and drawing most of the working air from the load for recirculation.
* The system includes features such as heat exchange of moisture-laden return air with fresh air, a hybrid evaporative cooler with a vapor compression refrigeration unit, and variations in air flow paths for quicker cooling or lower temperatures at higher energy costs.

<summary>
• The text describes an invention related to a desmodromic valve actuation system for internal combustion engines.
• The standard method of controlling valves in internal combustion engines uses a timing belt and cams, which are incapable of closing the port openings and require high spring loading for high cycling frequencies.
• The invention aims to provide means to significantly reduce gas consumption by efficiently and effectively controlling valve port openness.
• The valve control is simple, precise, and timely, resulting in smooth and sensitive engine performance.
• The valve actuation system is essentially springless and can be infinitely variable, allowing for precise control of valve opening and closing.
• The system can be computer controlled, allowing for the control of individual cylinders and their valves.
• The invention can be applied to engines with multiple valves per cylinder, with each valve being actuated by the same drive link.
• The invention offers advantages such as improved engine performance, reduced mass inertia, and elimination of the need for springs and their preloads.
</summary>

<summary>

- The invention relates to a nozzle for applying sealants, particularly silicones, in various industries such as aviation, automotive, naval, railway, and robotics.
- The nozzle comprises a bell or hood shaped tip and an injection button.
- The nozzle has a main elongated hollow body with a truncated cone shape and a threaded exterior surface for connecting to cartridges or injection machines.
- The bell or hood shaped section is sized to encapsulate rivets or nuts and provides a connection element.
- The injection button has a circular main body with a peripheral groove and a hollow central circular protrusion with multiple series of radially oriented channels ending in orifices.
- The bell shaped section and the injection button are cooperatively designed to allow a strong and firm non-permanent connection.
- The nozzle may be made of plastic, preferably polypropylene.
- The nozzle allows for precision sealing operations, including around rivet heads and in orifices where screws are inserted.
- The nozzle can be used with most cartridges or machines containing sealant in the market.
- The nozzle simplifies the sealing work, reducing sealant application time, saving time and labor, and increasing the quality of the resulting sealant application.

</summary>

<summary>

- The present invention relates to a cooled flow deflection apparatus for thermal machines, specifically for high-temperature fluid-flow machines.
- The invention aims to provide a simple, flexible, and efficiently cooled apparatus, avoiding the disadvantages of cast separating walls and deflection devices.
- The apparatus consists of separate inserts, composed of metal or non-metal materials, which are inserted into the apparatus and secured.
- Advantages include eliminating large amounts of material in the transitional region, reducing thermal stresses, decreasing blade weight, simplifying casting, and allowing easy cooling system adjustments.
- A preferred embodiment is a hollow casting with integrally formed holders for the separating walls, simplifying assembly and attachment.
- The separating walls can be flat strips, straight, or bent into a U-shape for deflecting cooling fluid.
- The cooling fluid can flow in mutually opposite directions in adjacent channels, with deflection produced by a bent separating wall.
- The invention can be applied to various types of blades, such as gas turbine blades, with radial cooling channels and integrated material joints for security.

</summary>

* The present invention introduces a point cap system with a small, lightweight point cap and adjustable balance pin for perfect arrow balance.
* The point cap system reduces the material and weight of arrow points, making it suitable for light and slim graphite arrows. It also provides a means to attach points to arrow shafts without allowing dirt to enter.
* The invention also includes a balance pin whose weight can be adjusted to balance an arrow shaft, and a point adaptor and nock cap for attaching various types of arrow points and nocks to the arrow shaft.

* The present invention relates to a collated fastener assembly and method for making it, which includes a row of fasteners arranged parallel to each other and a collation system formed from a plastic material that is molded onto and adhered to the fasteners.
* The plastic material defines a collar portion that captures or encircles the fastener shank and a connecting portion between adjacent fasteners. The plastic material is formulated from an adhesive polymer such as a polyolefin, a polyolefin blend, or an epoxy.
* The plastic collation system reduces debris generation during driving of the fastener by maintaining the plastic material on the shank and penetrating the substrate with the fastener. The plastic material also enhances the nails' holding power in the wood by embedding in the wood structure and bonding with it.
* The collation system is designed to minimize or eliminate corrugation while reducing the amount of debris generated. It can be configured with a taper or thinned region at the collar closest to the tip of the nail, a notch or weakened region at the juncture of the connecting portion and the next adjacent nail, or a smaller cross-sectional area at the juncture of the connecting portion and the collar of a subsequent fastener.
* The collation system can also include upper and lower plastic moldings adhered to the fasteners, with the lower molding formed nearer to the tip of the fastener and the upper molding formed nearer to the head of the fastener. The lower molding is formed on the shank within the lower half and preferably within about ½ inch of the tip of the fastener.
* The method for making the fastener assembly includes arranging a plurality of fasteners in a row parallel to one another, preheating the fasteners prior to molding the plastic material to them, molding the plastic material onto the preheated fasteners and between adjacent fasteners, and cooling the strip to form the fastener assembly. The strip can then be post heat treated.

<summary>

- The text describes a lighting system for aquariums using LEDs, with a modular design allowing for customizable color temperature and intensity.
- The lighting system includes a housing with a bottom side facing the aquarium and a lighting control region with multiple channels for controlling different colors.
- Each channel can be controlled independently using switches on the housing, and modules with LEDs can be attached to the lighting control region and connected to the channels.
- The modules have a thin profile and can be square or have different dimensions. Some modules may include narrow incident angle LEDs, wide angle LEDs, or optical elements.
- The system can include multiple lighting control regions, each with its own set of control channels and neutral channel, or a single control region with multiple channels.
- Some modules may include RF communication hardware for remote control, and the system can be controlled using timers for setting on/off times and dimming effects.

</summary>

• The invention provides a two-part mounting bracket assembly for installing speakers or other objects on various surfaces, allowing for easy and one-person installation.
• The assembly includes a stationary bracket attached to the mounting surface and an adjustable bracket attached to the object, which can be positioned and locked onto the stationary bracket for secure attachment. The design also includes pole adapters and a pole clamp assembly for mounting on poles.

<summary>
• The present invention provides an air intake device for an internal combustion engine with a tank, two pipes interconnecting the tank and intake passage, and a control valve in the larger pipe, actuated by an engine load condition.
• The smaller pipe is located upstream of the larger pipe and has a smaller cross-sectional area, which reduces noise from the air intake while maintaining dynamic effect.
• The volume of the tank and the narrow passage of the smaller pipe act as a resonator to absorb intake noise.
• The valve operation is controlled based on engine speed and load, with the valve closed when the load is below a certain level and opened when the load is above the level and engine speed is above a certain speed.
</summary>

<summary>
• Invention pertains to methods and apparatus for generating heat from particulate-laden gas or directly from waste fuels such as wood waste.
• Objectives include providing a clean burning waste fuel burner, reducing slag or clinkers, effectively burning wet wood, self-regulating, easy control, and producing a residue free of clinkers.
• Method involves forming a conical pile of waste fuel, preheating underfire air, and percolating it through the pile to dry and gasify the fuel.
• Swirl air is introduced tangentially to generate centrifugal forces, separating heavier materials from the gas stream and allowing volatile gases to pass upward.
• Flame holder forces entrained particulate matter out towards the walls where it is acted upon by the outer vortex, falling back into the primary chamber.
• Secondary combustion air is introduced tangentially and spirals down the walls to meet the mixture of volatile gases and moisture, completing combustion in the inner vortex.
• Flame holder serves as a barrier, preventing secondary chamber inner vortex from drawing primary chamber particulate material up into the secondary chamber.
• Pressure isolator isolates the primary chamber from secondary chamber combustion air by imposing an additional resistance to tangential secondary combustion air movement.
• Quantity of high pressure swirl air admitted to the primary chamber is varied according to the primary chamber exit temperature to maintain optimal gasification and continuous ignition.
• Conventional gas burners are mounted in the sides of the primary and secondary chambers to ignite the fuel pile on start-up and preheat the secondary chamber.
</summary>

<summary>

• The text describes an invention related to support structures, specifically a mounting link between an engine and a gearbox.
• Aircraft gas turbine auxiliary gearboxes need to withstand extreme loads, including blade-off events, which can cause major damage.
• The invention includes a link assembly with a male and female link, a radial interface between them, and a pin to selectively retain them.
• The female link receives the male link to allow translation and form a radial interface for dampening translation.
• The pin is releasably coupled to both links to retain them until extreme loads cause it to shear.
• The radial interface provides coulomb damping to dissipate energy from translation.
• The snap ring can limit the relative travel of the male link within the female link to prevent separation after the pin shears.
• The use of the pin and radial interface obviates the need for all linkages and connections to survive extreme loads.
• The pin can be replaced during maintenance following any shock sufficient to break it.
• The terminology is not limiting, and many modifications and variations are possible without departing from the scope and spirit of the invention.

</summary>

<summary>
• The present invention is an electronically controlled pyrotechnic sound and flash simulator for military small arms training, utilizing a low-cost plastic expendable housing a metal/oxidizer pyrotechnic and an electrical ignition system.
• The invention produces sound and flash by electrical ignition in a confined space and venting the combustion through the weapon's ejection port.
• The electrical control circuit provides automatic and semiautomatic fire, interfaces with the weapon trigger and bolt, and ensures safety precautions such as inhibiting pyrotechnic charges when the weapon bolt is open.
• The circuitry consists of ten functional blocks, including bolt and trigger interfaces, oscillator controls, firing counter, decoder, and control, as well as a MILES interface.
• The expendable is a series of thirty cups, each containing a pyrotechnic charge, which is ignited by heating a bridge wire to incandescence, causing a rapid increase in pressure and simulating small arms fire through overpressure levels and duration.
• The invention aims to provide a realistic simulation of small arms fire noise and flash, an inexpensive means for realistic training using an actual weapon, and a reliable, low maintenance, reusable small arms training device.
</summary>

<summary>

• The present invention relates to engine compression release brake systems for engines with less than all cylinders having engine brakes.
• Traditional engine compression release brake systems include an engine brake for each cylinder, leading to excess components and reduced engine robustness.
• The present invention includes an engine with a modular engine compression release brake system having engine brakes for a portion of the engine cylinders.
• Each cylinder is operably connected to hydraulically and/or mechanically actuated devices, including a hydraulically actuated engine compression release brake that is operably connected to the exhaust valve for the cylinder.
• Each engine brake has a brake body and an electrical actuator, such as a solenoid, that opens and closes a high pressure seat to block or allow high pressure fluid to flow into the actuation fluid passage.
• A spool valve member is movable between an upward, retracted position and a downward, advanced position, and is biased toward its retracted position by a biasing spring.
• When the engine brake is activated, high pressure fluid flows into the actuation fluid passage, moving the piston toward its downward, advanced position and opening the exhaust valve actuator to allow exhaust gases to be released.
• The engine compression release brake system can improve engine robustness by reducing the number of engine components.
• The present invention can be used with engines having any number of cylinders and can include any number of engine brakes that is less than the total number of cylinders.

</summary>

<summary>

- The text describes a fluid pump with two or more pump heads arranged in series, where fluid flows from a reservoir into one pump head and then into the next pump head in the series, to be eventually discharged from an outlet in a final pump head.
- Each pump head comprises a housing within which an impeller is contained, the impeller being driven by a drive structure to move fluid. The housing of the pump head comprises an inlet through which fluid is drawn from outside the housing, and the fluid is moved by the impeller from the housing into at least two fluid conduits, preferably at least three fluid conduits, to be combined into one fluid flow before exiting the pump head.
- The drive structure comprises any one or collection of structures that is configured to impart rotational motion on the impellers. It is preferably powered by a single power source, such as a motor.
- The pump heads are connected to provide rigidity and a fluid seal between the pump heads. They may be removably connected or may be formed in a unitary structure.
- The pump may be mounted on a support structure, such as a wheeled boom, a hitching assembly, or a trailer, to permit operation at a fluid reservoir.
- The text also describes a biconical tubular connector used to connect two pump heads and frictionally secure one drive shaft in it, preventing fluid from entering the drive train and protecting it from corrosion and befouling.
- The text also mentions that the pump cannot be constructed by simply stacking known pumps together, as the intermediate pump heads have design features to permit series flow of fluid and common driving of the impellers.

</summary>

* The text describes a burner system for various heat utilizing appliances with interchangeable modules.
* The burner has a combustion chamber with an outer wall, an inner shroud, and a fuel holder. Air flows through the fuel holder for initial combustion and around it for secondary and tertiary combustion.
* The burner includes a pivotally coupled ash pan, a perforate food grate, and a cover to prevent inadvertent ingress and suppress live embers.
* The burner has manual couplings for attaching various modular heat utilizing appliances, such as cookers, a food smoker, a space heater, and a pyrolyzer.
* The pyrolyzer is a modular heat utilizing appliance that can be attached to the burner and includes a sealed heating chamber for pyrolyzing carboniferous materials, a condenser for recovering liquids, and a vent for exhausting gases.

* The text describes the use of kinematic mounts in spacecraft applications and the need to reduce vibration levels to protect instruments.
* Two preferred embodiments of vibration damping materials are presented: a spherical damper and a cylindrical slot damper.
* The damping materials are designed to have frequency-dependent properties, allowing them to dissipate vibration energy during launch while minimally affecting instrument stability on-orbit.
* The text also suggests alternative damped kinematic mount designs, such as truss structures or a set of three damped versions of the mount configuration, and discusses the benefits of a center-of-gravity mounting system.

<summary>
• The present invention is a method of minimizing steam boiler pressure changes or turbine power changes during turbine control valve operational safety testing using control valve positions as feedback.
• The method involves calculating total mass flow for N parallel flow valves as a function of control valve position and determining the difference in flow characteristics between N and N-1 turbine flow control valves.
• A "smoothing out" curve is obtained to provide a more appropriate curve to control flow change of the remaining open valves to minimize flow disturbance of the closed valve.
• The test compensation circuit uses a look-up table to provide the required flow compensation for the three input control valves not being tested based on the mass flow demanded by the TCV Reference.
• The use of the control valve test compensating control system reduced the pressure excursion of the turbine inlet main steam pressure by 95% compared to not using flow compensation.
</summary>

* The present invention proposes a method and arrangement for compressing gas in a compressor station for a gas pipeline, particularly in permanent frost areas. The method includes compressing gas to an excess pressure, cooling it by heat exchange, and expanding it to the desired exit pressure to obtain further cooling.
* The compressor station includes at least one compressor, heat exchanger, valve-controlled pipelines, control units, and an electronic control system. The electronic control system operates to compress gas to an excess pressure and expand it to the desired exit pressure.
* The invention utilizes the physical effect that a compressed gas is cooled when expanded to a lower pressure. The excess pressure is selected to ensure sufficient cooling during expansion to reach the desired exit temperature.
* The compressor station can be operated efficiently throughout the entire year, as compressors can be exchanged during the cold season and the compressors of the second primary compression stage can be operated parallel with those of the first primary compression stage during the warm season.

<summary>
• The invention relates to a mixing valve for an aircraft cleaning apparatus with two inlets and one outlet, allowing a solution ranging from 0% inlet A fluid, 100% inlet B fluid to 100% inlet A fluid, 0% inlet B fluid.
• The valve system includes a valve body with a bore and two inlet passages, one for soap solution and one for water, both receiving fluids at specific pressures.
• A flow restricting device is used in the soap solution inlet to reduce its flow rate.
• The valve body also defines an outlet passage with a threaded portion for connecting to a pipe, and an adjustable valve means for directing the two fluids toward the outlet passage.
• The valve means is adjustable to permit the mixture to range between 0% first fluid, 100% second fluid to about 100% second fluid, 0% first fluid.
• The valve system maintains constant pressure cleaning solution to each user while allowing them to adjust the cleaning agent to water ratio.
• The valve system allows multiple identical valve systems to be operated from a common soap solution source and common water source without affecting fluid pressure.
</summary>

<summary>

- The invention relates to a large size clutch unit for an aircraft catapult system, utilizing interleaved clutch plates and discs, and separate means for closing the gap between each disc and its adjacent plates using piston and cylinder means.
- The clutch unit employs hydraulic fluid for retracting the plate actuating means to reduce residual drag and as a coolant for the clutch discs.
- The clutch discs are made up of smaller arcuate segments, allowing their fabrication using conventional retort equipment and easy replacement without requiring complete disassembly of the unit.
- The clutch unit provides accurate fluid pressure control, strong coupling forces between plates and discs, and minimizes residual drag while maintaining high control accuracy.

</summary>

<summary>

- The text describes a cooling fan assembly system that eliminates the need for fasteners to secure the fan to a panel.
- The fan assembly includes a motor, fan blade, and mounting legs with resilient leg portions and spring members.
- The panel provides the mounting interface and includes recess portions with enlarged and residual openings.
- To install the fan assembly, a combined compressive and rotating force is applied to the fan or panel, compressing the spring member and moving the fan into the partially and fully installed positions.
- In the fully installed position, the spring member urges the fan against the panel, preventing vibrational noise and preventing the fan from backing out of the opening.
- The fan assembly can be used in various applications where forced air cooling is necessary, including computers and automotive industries.
- The design allows for easier installation and reduces the cost of the product by eliminating the need for fasteners and associated labor and handling costs.

</summary>

Note: The summary is based on the information provided in the text and may not include all the details or nuances of the invention described in the patent document. It is recommended to read the full patent document for a more comprehensive understanding of the invention.

<summary>

- The text discusses the issues with cooling and ignition systems in rotary internal combustion engines, specifically focusing on the use of in-line spark plug bosses and their impact on cooling performance.
- In-line spark plug bosses create flow disruptions, vapor film build-up, and boiling at the plugs, which prevent controlled heat transfer and worsen the heat transfer problem.
- The invention aims to provide an efficient ignition and cooling system combination, a housing structure for circumferential cooling, and a housing with separate flow paths for vapor release during boiling heat transfer.
- The housing structure employs staggered spark plug bosses to promote relatively close in-line arrangement of the spark plug terminals, minimize thermal distortion, and increase the heat transfer coefficient of the cooling circuit.
- The staggered arrangement of the spark plug bosses promotes high velocity flow, controls swirling eddies, and maintains a high heat transfer coefficient at the sensitive spark plug boss surfaces.
- The tests on water model passageways showed that staggered spark plug bosses increased the heat transfer coefficient by up to 44% compared to in-line bosses.
- The invention is important for spacings between bosses up to 50 boss diameters when the boss diameter is relatively small, and for longitudinal spacings between bosses of up to 12 diameters when the boss diameter is relatively large.
- The benefits of this invention include controlled high velocity flow, devoid of uncontrolled swirling eddies, and a high heat transfer coefficient at the sensitive spark plug boss surfaces.

</summary>

* The text describes methods and systems for obtaining and processing customer service location information, including latitude and longitude coordinates, using a GPS system and a technician server.
* The text also discusses generating directions for a service technician traveling between multiple customer service locations using a mapping system and the obtained coordinates.

* The present invention relates to a method for investigating a sample derived from a biological source using CARS microscopy, which involves furnishing at least one resonance site by means of a bioorthogonal reaction of an intrinsic chemical structure of the sample with at least one reaction partner.
* The method allows the introduction of resonance sites into a sample that does not inherently possess them, enabling selective detection and imaging of specific structures in the sample, as well as the generation of a reproducible counter-stain for improved quantitative conclusions.

<summary>
• The text describes a method for collecting specimens in hospitals to reduce mislabeling.
• Most hospitals use ID bands with patient information, but errors occur, especially in emergency rooms.
• The method involves generating unique patient, order, and vial barcodes and storing them in a relational database.
• The blood drawer inputs all barcodes into the computer, which checks for a match between patient and order barcodes.
• If a match is found, the computer generates a signal for the blood drawer to draw blood and store it in the corresponding vial.
• The computer stores the specimen collection time and sends the vials to the lab with the order and label information.
• The method eliminates the need for vial labels and reduces errors, making the process more efficient and cost-effective.
</summary>

• The text describes an engine system with combustion cylinders and expansion cylinders, where exhaust gas from the combustion cylinders is delivered to the expansion cylinders for further expansion using water injection. The system aims to eliminate the need for a radiator by efficiently capturing and transferring heat from the combustion cylinders to the expansion cylinders.
• The text also discusses various features such as water recovery systems, gearing between cylinders, and catalytic materials on surfaces exposed to hot exhaust gases for reducing exhaust emissions.
• The engine system is designed to achieve high thermal-to-mechanical efficiencies, with steady-state thermal budgets showing significant reductions in thermal losses compared to conventional engines. The text also addresses concerns related to breathing and back pressure in the system and proposes various solutions.

<summary>
• The document describes an invention of a voice-activated distance measuring device for golfers, using GPS and voice recognition technology.
• The device can be incorporated into articles of clothing or headgear, such as a golf hat or visor.
• The device uses commercially available GPS data to measure distance and other golf course parameters.
• The device includes voice recognition technology to accept voice commands and voice synthesis technology to provide audible output.
• The device may also accept and memorize data to predict golf course strategy and provide golf instructions.
• The device may use Bluetooth technology for data transfers, audio communications, and remote GPS.
</summary>

<summary>

- The text describes an invention related to data processing systems and floating point operations.
- The floating point format allows for manipulation of numerical quantities in increased ranges, but addition and subtraction operations are more complex and time-consuming than in standard data format.
- The effective subtraction operation involves aligning operand fractions, determining the difference between exponent arguments, and normalizing and rounding the result.
- The present invention aims to accelerate the effective subtraction operation by using a difference between a subset of signals in the operand exponent arguments to begin subtraction of operand fractions.
- The procedures are chosen such that when the complete operand argument difference is different from the subset operand argument difference, the correct result fraction is one of the operand fractions, which is available.
- The text outlines the steps for performing the effective subtraction operation when the absolute value of the difference in the arguments of the exponents is less than or equal to one and when it is greater than one.
- The apparatus implementing the procedures includes a subtraction unit, detection and logic unit, shift and selection logic unit, and selection logic unit.

</summary>

• The present invention concerns a method for fabricating plates or blanks of coated steel intended for welding and heat treatment to obtain parts with good mechanical characteristics and corrosion resistance.
• The invention eliminates the need for special atmospheres in furnaces during heat treatment by using a coating that prevents decarburization and oxidation.
• The method involves removing the metal alloy layer from the periphery of the plate before welding to prevent the introduction of the coating into the molten area and ensure satisfactory corrosion resistance after heat treatment.
• The removal of the metal alloy layer can be achieved by brushing or laser ablation, and the width of the removed area must be adjusted to enable welding without introducing any element of the precoat into the molten area and to ensure satisfactory corrosion resistance.
• The invention provides a plate consisting of a steel substrate and a precoat consisting of a layer of intermetallic alloy in contact with the substrate, topped by a layer of metal alloy, with a portion of the periphery of the plate retaining the intermetallic alloy layer and no longer carrying the metal alloy layer. The invention also provides a welded blank obtained by butt-welding at least two plates according to the invention, and a part obtained by heat treatment and deformation of the welded blank.

<summary>

- The text describes a system for assessing segmentations from various sources in radiation therapy.
- The system receives segmentations as electronic files, converts them to volume models, and compares the models to identify missing and extra volume elements.
- The missing and extra volume elements are measured and optionally weighted based on their distance from the reference volume elements.
- The system can be used for periodic quality assurance of autosegmentation routines or evaluation of those routines when they are updated or used with new imaging technology.
- The system uses a metric method to measure the conformance between the segmentations, which may be a combination of a constant value, a linear function of the number of error volume elements with distance, and an exponential function of the number of error volume elements with distance.
- The system displays the results of the comparison on a graphics display screen, allowing the user to improve their segmentation skills or autosegmentation programs by identifying not only the quality of the segmentation but the regions of error.
- The system can display the segmentation region differences against the underlying data used for the segmentation, providing additional instructive detail for an individual improving their skills or for an individual assessing an autosegmentation program.
- The system is sensitive to both overinclusive and underinclusive segmentation, both of which can have significant clinical effects.
- The system can be customized with wholly customized metric methods as knowledge in this area advances.

</summary>

Note: The summary is based on the information provided in the text and may not include all the details or implications of the invention described in the text.

<summary>

- The present invention provides a design rule checking system and method for accurately reporting errors for appropriate regions in a system that includes two different kinds of circuits, such as memory and logic.
- The invention eliminates false errors caused by design rule checking tools examining regions that are not subject to the same design rules.
- The method applies the right set of rules to the right regions of the mask pattern data by creating customized design rules based on modifying a standard logic rule file to take into consideration minimum dimensional values extracted from memory bit cell design parameters.
- The system can identify different types of memory regions and apply distinct and separate design rules to each type.
- The invention checks different regions with different design rules to ensure that all types of memory regions fulfill all memory rules of their group, and all logic regions fulfill logic and memory rules.
- The process is superior to prior art techniques in that it avoids false errors and is more reliable and efficient.
- The invention can be applied to various industries, including semiconductor, LCD manufacturing, and similar micro-patterned technologies.

</summary>

<summary>

- The invention relates to a rolling body guide cage produced from at least one ring element and several guide structures, with the ring element made from sheet metal and having axial profiling formed by forming techniques.
- The ring element consists of at least two flat material ring segments joined together in the circumferential direction and connected via joints in a production step before axial profiling.
- The flat material ring segments are welded along edge regions facing each other within the joints, forming engagement zones where they are connected positively.
- The geometric profile of the joint contours is selected to ensure adequate coupling of the ring segments.
- The ring segments are cut out as 120° ring segments, which can be punched out in close succession from a sheet metal strip and form a joined together ring element for a rolling body guide cage.
- The ring element can be used to produce various types of rolling body guide cages, such as for groove ball bearings, axial cylinder roller guides, and axial ball bearings.
- The weld points between individual ring segments can be formed using laser welding or pressure welding.
- The ring segments can be produced with a slight oversize and then cut and calibrated after welding or cut to their final dimensions before forming and welding.
- The punching and welding steps can be carried out with overlap, allowing the ring segments to be joined together and formed into a ring segment before being welded.
- The initially punched out or cut out ring segments can be joined together to form a stack or ring segment block and then supplied to a welding station for insertion into an annular groove of a rotary plate and welding.

</summary>

<summary>

- The text describes a method for granting access to native resources of an operating system to managed applications through managed libraries, while ensuring security by validating digital certificates.
- The method includes receiving a request from a managed application to access a native system resource through a managed library, authorizing the request by the manager (effectuated by native instructions), and sending a request to access the native system resource to a runtime host (effectuated by native instructions).
- The text also discusses receiving a package from a networked computer system, identifying an executable in the package, and verifying managed metadata associated with the executable to ensure type-safe code.
- The method can be used in a closed mobile device environment, where the provider wants to allow third parties to develop applications while maintaining security.
- The text also mentions the use of containers, digital signatures, and electronic marketplaces for distributing and purchasing verified applications.

</summary>

* The invention provides an identification card with a core layer, at least one antenna and chip attached to the core layer, a bottom sheet, and two laminate layers sandwiched between the core layer and bottom sheet.
* The core layer is made of a silica-filled polyolefin and pre-shrunk before printing indicia and attaching electronic components. The bottom sheet is also made of a silica-filled polyolefin and has an adhesive layer for bonding the core layer and bottom sheet.
* The card is laminated with two transparent polymer layers and an image-receiving layer on each side, which can be protected by a biaxially oriented polyester or other optically clear durable plastic layer. The protective layer may include additional security features.

* The text describes a method and apparatus for non-destructively testing dynamoelectric machine rotors, specifically squirrel cage rotors for induction motors, to determine resistance, reactance, and effective electrical skew.
* The apparatus includes a test head with excitation means, voltage sensing pick-up coils, skew sensing pick-up coils, and a current sensor. The test head rotates the rotor and senses the induced voltages and currents to calculate power values, which are then used to determine resistance, reactance, and effective skew.
* The data acquisition and processing circuit controls the acquisition and processing of the test data, and the control processor determines the mean resistance, reactance, and effective skew values, as well as the dissymmetry and skew dissymmetry values. The system provides automatic pass/fail determinations based on predetermined threshold values.
* The system also stores statistical information on a Winchester magnetic disk, including the number of passed and fail rotors, running sums of the calculated values, and running sums of the squares of the values. This data allows for determination of averages and standard deviation over numerous tests.

<summary>

- The text describes a system for compensating electromagnetic interfering fields using two real triaxial magnetic field sensors, three pairs of compensation coils, and one control unit.
- The control unit receives the six output signals of the two real sensors and processes them to generate control signals for the six coils.
- The signals from the two real sensors are combined to form the output signals of a virtual sensor, which represents the amplitude of the interfering field at the location of the object to be protected.
- The virtual sensor signals are processed by independent control loops operating in parallel, which change the signals to modified signals.
- The modified signals are then used to calculate control signals for the six coils.
- The algorithm used by the control system is described as a matrix multiplication.
- The system can compensate both homogeneous and inhomogeneous magnetic fields.
- If two compensation systems are operated directly beside each other, feedback effects may occur, which are accounted for by providing a feedback matrix C.
- The feedback matrix C computationally eliminates the parts of the signals that are crosstalks from one output signal to a virtual signal.
- The system can be used to compensate for interfering fields in various applications, such as imaging systems using magnetic fields.
</summary>

Additionally, the text mentions that the system can be optimized for specific applications and that the control unit can be designed as a control processor such as a Digital Signal Processor (DSP) or a field programmable gate array (FPGA). It also mentions that the control loops can be broadband, selective concerning a frequency range, or selective concerning a frequency, and that the control algorithm is not limited to being a matrix. The text also describes a schematic presentation of the system and its control system, as well as a block diagram for calculating the control signals of the system. Furthermore, it mentions that the system can be used to compensate for interfering fields in various applications, such as scanning electron microscopes (SEM).

* The present invention describes methods to manufacture embedded EPROM devices using existing IC technologies, specifically using DRAM storage capacitors as EPROM coupling capacitors.
* The advantages of this approach include the ability to manufacture EPROM devices on the same wafer as DRAM devices without additional cost, larger coupling capacitors leading to lower operation voltages, and the potential to build programmable redundancy circuits using EPROM devices.

<summary>
• The text describes an invention for using waveguide holograms as controlled illuminators for objects with specific illumination requirements, such as holograms and spatial light modulators.
• Thin substrate waveguides, which are characterized by a relationship between the width of an incident laser beam and the waveguide's thickness, are particularly useful for controlled illumination due to their ability to avoid difficulties in coupling optical sources and allow for convenient white light illumination.
• Conventional illumination systems require a substantial amount of space and can have stability problems, alignment difficulties, and obstruction of other light beams. Waveguide hologram illuminators offer a more compact and rugged solution.
• Waveguide hologram illuminators can achieve extremely high diffraction efficiencies and can compensate for non-uniformity of the diffracted wavefront in the direction of propagation.
• The text discusses potential challenges with waveguide hologram illuminators, including alignment requirements, time delays, and non-uniformity of the diffracted wavefront along the propagation direction.
• The invention can be used for various applications, including display holograms, holographic recording of two plane waves, and illuminating reflective spatial light modulators.
</summary>

<summary>

- The present application is a continuation of a previous patent application related to a SCADA system for energy extracting vessel navigation.
- The invention is in the field of supervisory control and data acquisition systems for mobile structures that optimally recover energy from an offshore marine environment.
- Existing systems for wind and hydrokinetic energy recovery have limitations, including high manufacturing and operational costs and the need for hazardous conditions for human crews.
- The present invention addresses these limitations by providing a remote control system for a mobile structure that cost-effectively extracts energy in an optimal manner from an environment that presents untenable risk to human life.
- The system includes computer servers that gather data from various sources, such as GPS systems, weather satellites, and telecommunications satellites, and run HMI software applications.
- The system is not limited to implementation with the Turbine-Integrated Hydrofoil system and can be used with any mobile structure that extracts energy from weather patterns.
- The system uses an algorithm to optimize energy extraction using yield functions derived from weather and geospatial data and vessel performance models.
- The system includes a control and communications microprocessor system on the mobile structure and a microprocessor system running secure server software applications and workstations running secure client software applications in the central service facility.
- The system uses wireless communication systems, such as CDMA or UHF radio, to communicate between the mobile structure and the central service facility.

</summary>
