• The invention relates to zoom lenses with increased relative aperture and good optical performance, while minimizing size and length for use in photographic and video cameras.
• To achieve this, the fourth and fifth lens units are designed with specific refractive powers and Abbe numbers to correct spherical aberration, astigmatism, and chromatic aberration.
• The invention also suggests satisfying certain conditions (1-5) regarding the radii of curvature, axial thicknesses, refractive indices, and Abbe numbers of the lenses to ensure high-grade optical performance.
• The invention has resulted in the realization of a large relative aperture, high range zoom lens with a reduced size, specifically a total length of L=9.13φ A to 9.19φ A.

<summary>
• The text describes a method for determining the optimum values of feedback gains (P, I, and D) used in feedback control systems.
• Feedback control is commonly used for guiding an automatic guidance vehicle (AGV) along a predetermined course.
• The correction amount is calculated based on the error detected between the actual and desired values of the controlled variable.
• The text introduces evaluation functions (LR, Svv, and Asv) to accurately evaluate the influence of each gain on the voltage curve.
• The evaluation functions are used to determine the optimum values of the P, I, and D gains by entering the optimum value range or by function interpolation.
• The method can be applied to different types of control systems and can be used to obtain the optimum values of other feedback gains.
• The text also mentions two different methods for obtaining the ideal values of gains from evaluation function data.
</summary>

• The text describes a matrix display device that merges two images with different definitions for simultaneous display.
• The device applies algorithms to best preserve the definition of the higher definition image.
• The matrix display device consists of a controller and a matrix of pixels organized in a mosaic of identical arrangements.
• Each arrangement has pixels dedicated to displaying the first image and pixels dedicated to displaying the second image.
• The controller applies light intensity signals to the pixels based on the corresponding pixels of each image.
• The text provides examples of arrangements and color combinations for the merged images.

<summary>
• The text describes a mobile identification transmitter for activating a security system of a motor vehicle, which also functions as a payment device.
• The payment element is removably fastened in a receptacle of the housing, and the identification transmitter can be set in a normal state and a secure state.
• In the secure state, the payment element is removed, and the closure protects and seals the receptacle.
• The payment element can be brought into data communication with a payment system and has a credit card or debit card function.
• The closure effectively prevents disruptions to the connection between the payment element and the electronics of the identification transmitter, and prevents moisture and dirt particles from penetrating the interior of the housing.
</summary>

<summary>

- The present invention relates to implementing a FIFO-type queue in a functional memory using a tree-shaped structure.
- In functional memories, a typical way of implementing a FIFO queue using a double-ended list is ineffective due to the large amount of copying required for each update.
- The invention achieves an improvement by implementing and maintaining a queue using a tree-shaped structure in which additions and deletions are directed to specific leaf nodes.
- The tree-shaped data structure is a balanced tree where all leaf nodes are at the same level and all nodes are full except for those on the edges.
- Additions are made to the tree by filling up nodes in a bottom-up manner, and deletions are made from the tree by removing the rightmost leaf node.
- A header node is added to the tree structure in a preferred embodiment, which contains a tree representing the middle part of the FIFO queue, a leaf node at the beginning, and a leaf node at the end.
- The header node allows for faster and less space-consuming updates as only a constant time is required for additions and deletions independent of the length of the queue.
- A bit is added to the header node to indicate the direction of the queue, allowing for inversion of the queue in constant time and space.
- The invention can be implemented in a memory arrangement with an actual memory, intermediate registers, control logic, and input/output registers.
- The invention can be modified within the scope of the inventive idea, such as allowing for variable node sizes or separating the records from the tree.

</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to an improved apparatus for automatically spin checking a driven disc assembly.
• The apparatus includes a stationary ring, a movable ring, a torque motor, and a servo motor.
• The torque motor is used to apply a predetermined torque to the driven disc assembly, while the servo motor moves the movable ring to engage and disengage the assembly.
• An electronic sensor measures the distance between the rings when the driven disc assembly is engaged.
• The torque motor is then energized to rotate the driven disc assembly against the frictional force generated by the rings.
• The movable ring is gradually moved away from the stationary ring to reduce the frictional force.
• When the frictional force decreases enough, the driven disc assembly begins to rotate under the urging of the torque motor.
• The distance separating the rings at this point is measured and compared to a standard value to determine if the driven disc assembly is excessively warped.
• The apparatus generates an external indication to the operator of whether the driven disc assembly is good or bad.
</summary>

• The present invention relates to a rotary magnetic head type apparatus that allows independent and precise regulation of bias currents supplied to plural MR heads mounted on a rotary drum in a simple structure.
• The apparatus uses a control signal generator on the stationary drum side and a decoder circuit and current supply circuit on the rotary drum side to control the operating currents of magneto resistive heads using a single channel of a rotary transformer.
• The invention also enables switching over among plural heads, including MR and recording heads, with high precision and at high speed by generating control data for controlling the recording/reproducing unit, transmitting the control data to the recording/reproducing unit, and prioritizing head switching signal data and MR current control signal data in the transmission.

<summary>
• An imaging device, such as a xerographic machine, goes into sleep mode when inactive to save energy.
• A toner concentration sensor measures the concentration of toner in the developer by detecting the tribo charge of the toner.
• The toner charge decreases when the imaging device is inactive for a long period, affecting image quality.
• Exemplary embodiments include methods and apparatus for charging toner based on periods of inactivity and measuring toner charge levels.
• The relationship between inactivity time and toner charge is approximated by a power law.
• The inactivity determining section determines user usage patterns and predicts next usage based on these patterns.
• The calculating section calculates the decay of the tribo charge of the toner based on sensor level differences.
• Upon determination of inactivity, the charging section instructs the machine to charge the toner to a predetermined level.
• The performing section performs a printing operation after the developer is charged.
</summary>

* The invention provides a cover plate device for wall-mounted electrical wiring devices with no visible fasteners, which is easily installed or removed, and can accommodate variations in wall flatness or evenness.
* The device consists of a two-part system: an attachment plate attached to the wiring device using available fasteners, and a cover plate latched to the attachment plate with multi-step racks and latching pawls, allowing each pawl to mate with its associated rack independently.

<summary>

• The present invention relates to methods and software for estimating the age of a person from their image data using a contourlet appearance model (CAM) and age classification.

• The CAM algorithm extracts facial features that encode age information and distinguishes noise from meaningful signals in a given image.

• The method involves training a database of second image data with assigned landmark points and known ages using a CAM algorithm to extract feature vectors.

• Support Vector Regression (SVR) is used to construct two aging functions, a growth and development mapping function and an adult aging mapping function, from the youth and adult training face feature vectors.

• Support Vector Machines (SVMs) are used to build an age classifier capable of distinguishing between youths and adults based on their feature vectors.

• Given a new image, the CAM algorithm is used to extract feature vectors, which are then classified as youth or adult using the SVM-trained classifier.

• The appropriate aging function is used to estimate the age based on the determination of the young/adult classifier.

• The estimated age is provided in the form of a single age or age indicator with an optional confidence factor.

• The methods can be implemented using a computing system containing a processor, memory, and bus for communication between components.
</summary>

<summary>
• The text describes an invention for interfacing a speaker phone with a telephone network to enable hands-free automatic answering and communication.
• The invention includes a source of power, selective switch means, a coupler for automatically connecting the telephone network to the speaker device, and a timer for limiting the time duration of the interconnection.
• Two embodiments are presented: one using an optocoupler and the other using a neon lamp and photocell.
• The system is designed to be portable, easily connectable to an existing telephone system, and modular for versatility and cost-effectiveness.
• The invention aims to provide a simplified, reliable, and low-cost solution for hands-free telephone communication, particularly beneficial for individuals with physical limitations or dangerous work environments.
</summary>

* The present invention introduces a collapsible light-shielding device for a screen, consisting of concentrically nested annular strips that can slide over one another between a pushed-in and pushed-out position. This design allows the shielding device to fold around the screen and take up minimal space when not in use.
* The light-shielding device features hooks or locking elements on the strips to ensure reliable folding and an adapter member with a flat attachment face for easy mounting on various types of monitors. The strips can have a decreasing wall thickness in the axial direction, enabling the device to be set to various angular positions for unobstructed viewing of the displaying screen.

<summary>

- The invention is concerned with locating and tracing concealed elongated conductive objects, particularly in the presence of adjacent objects.
- The system includes a transmitter with a pair of antennae for inducing distinguishable alternating currents in the objects, and a receiver for sensing magnetic fields associated with the currents and producing an output signal dependent on both fields.
- The transmitter antennae may be positioned optimally relative to the cables to produce two distinct output signal nulls over respective cables, allowing for easier and more accurate tracing.
- The currents in the respective cables may be made distinguishable using techniques such as different carrier frequencies, amplitude modulation, or pulsing at different repetition rates.
- The invention is especially useful in environments where the horizontal separation between cables is related to their depth, and the field from the transmitter decreases by the inverse cube of the distance, reducing inducement of currents from both antennae in the same cable.
- The system can be adapted to work with a single cable by designing the transmitter to only energize one antenna when a single cable is present.
</summary>

<summary>

- The present invention is a system for reducing or eliminating undersea optical repeaters in a trunk and branch ring network by replacing repeaters with remotely pumped optical amplifiers and supplying energy to those amplifiers over the same branch cables.
- The system includes an optical fiber cable trunk configured in ring topology with one or more telecommunications hubs, branching units, and cable stations.
- The branch fiber optic cable is used to transmit both communications signals and optical energy to remotely located optical amplifiers.
- The hub assembly includes a hub, a light emitting power source, and an optical amplifier, with the power source and amplifier located remotely from each other.
- The trunk and branch structure with ring geometry provides strong survivability features, allowing for full connectivity even with a single trunk cut or multiple branch cuts.
- The system respects sovereignty concerns, is not restricted to fixed wavelength routing schemes, and can reduce capital and operating costs by utilizing repeaterless technology.
- The system can be applied to other methods of signal multiplexing and may also be used as a terrestrial communications system.

</summary>

<summary>

- The present invention relates to automated speech technologies that automatically indicate to a speaker when their rate of speech is likely to be greater than a rate that a listener can comprehend.
- The invention uses a speaking rate threshold based on a listener's proficiency with a language and a speaking rate determination to notify the speaker to slow down when necessary.
- The device can be a wearable computing device, such as a smartphone, or integrated into a teleprompter or other speech-giving mechanisms.
- The device includes a microphone, sensory mechanism, speaking rate processor, language detector, speech clarity processor, comprehension comparator, and wireless transceiver.
- The method involves identifying a discourse, detecting a language, determining a speaking rate, comparing it to a speaking threshold, and notifying the speaker to slow down if necessary. The threshold can be based on the listener's proficiency or estimated listening rate.

</summary>

<summary>

- The present invention relates to methods and systems for facilitating anonymous communication between finders and owners of lost or misplaced objects.
- Owners can register their contact information and unique IDs associated with their tags on a centralized database.
- Finders can access a website or virtual locale associated with a tag to initiate communication with the owner using the unique ID.
- The system allows for anonymous communication between the finder and owner, protecting their privacy.
- The system also enables timely communication, increasing the chances of the object being returned to its owner.
- The invention can be implemented using various programming languages, operating systems, and database systems, and can be adapted to different messaging protocols.

</summary>

<summary>

• The present invention allows existing network devices to support multimedia capabilities without replacing them.
• It uses a blender software to initiate parallel voice and multimedia components for a call, which are controlled by the blender to accommodate multimedia requests.
• The blender keeps control of the signaling paths of the parallel components to maintain control over the bearer paths.
• The invention is compatible with various network systems and protocols, including SIP.
• An incoming call is routed to the blender if the intended recipient supports blended services, and the blender initiates parallel voice and multimedia components.
• The multimedia server may handle both components as a single session or redirect the voice component back to the telephony server with a loopback signal.
• The invention can be used for both incoming and outgoing calls, and supports multimedia services such as instant messaging.

</summary>

<summary>

- The invention describes a device for optical recording of rapid processes using a TV camera with means for deviating and suppressing the beam to scan over N lines of a picture plane.
- The device includes a cyclic line counter, a sawtooth generator synchronized with the counter output, and a delay device to control the sawtooth generator and beam suppression circuit.
- The counter and delay device allow for selectable part of a line period, enabling higher picture sequence frequency and flexible TV recordings of rapid processes.
- The device can be used for laboratory and industrial processes requiring optical recording of rapidly changing phenomena, and is suitable for IR, UV, or X-ray pictures.
</summary>

Additionally, the device aims to provide a simple and cost-effective solution compared to high-speed cameras and film systems for immediate computer-assisted interpretation of recorded images. The counter is preferably programmable, allowing for adjustable picture scanning times and optimal time resolution with the best possible spatial resolution. The device can also record multiple scanning cycles to fill gaps between lines and improve automatic digital picture evaluation.

<summary>

- The invention relates to a method and device for detecting elementary particles, enabling both individual particle detection and signal integration without knowing count or signal rates in advance.
- The method involves discharging signals from the detector on the low-voltage side, allowing for simpler distinction of small-size signals and preventing leakage current in high-voltage cables.
- Signals are amplified in a fast amplifier for low-rate signals and integrated in a slow amplifier for high-rate signals, allowing for separate measurements and integrations.
- Capacitors, high-pass filters, inductive elements, or low-pass filters are used to separate signals based on their rates.
- Diamond detector material, which enables fast charge transport at room temperature, is proposed for wide signal or count rate detection.
- A converter material is used to detect uncharged particles in the detector material.
- The invention can be applied in particle accelerators, reactor installations, diagnostic devices, and electrical power engineering.
- The device includes a detector, amplifiers, evaluation units, capacitors, inductive elements, and a support capacitor for rapid compensation of detector discharge at high beam rates.

</summary>

The text describes a method and device for detecting elementary particles, such as protons, ions, electrons, neutrons, and photons. The invention aims to enable both the detection of individual particles and the integration of signals when exceeding a threshold value, without requiring knowledge of count or signal rates in advance. The method involves discharging signals from the detector on the low-voltage side, which simplifies the distinction of small-size signals and prevents leakage current in high-voltage cables. Signals are amplified in a fast amplifier for low-rate signals and integrated in a slow amplifier for high-rate signals, and capacitors, high-pass filters, inductive elements, or low-pass filters are used to separate signals based on their rates. Diamond detector material, which enables fast charge transport at room temperature, is proposed for wide signal or count rate detection. A converter material is used to detect uncharged particles in the detector material. The invention can be applied in particle accelerators, reactor installations, diagnostic devices, and electrical power engineering. • The present invention relates to a content synchronization framework for connected devices that allows for contextual synchronization over various communication network topologies.
• The framework includes a central reference point server, client devices, network connectivity, and external partners. The client shares contextual information with the central reference point, which compiles bundle information based on the dynamic arbitrary attribute information provided in the request.
• The response from the central reference point contains bundles, each with properties that direct the client in understanding the content and properties of the files named in the bundle. The client composes a delta list of all the files in the bundle that are different from local copies and downloads the files in the ordered delta list from various servers.
• The framework supports limited bandwidth and limited connection time over dial-up or similar connections by employing data compression for responses and rejecting incomplete bundles. In the event of communication connection failure, the client device downloads bundles that failed to download in previous sessions during subsequent synchronization sessions.

* The present invention discloses a method and apparatus for dicing semiconductor wafers using pressure to mechanically separate individual die without the use of a wafer saw.
* The process involves forming trenches along the scribe lines on the wafer and applying mechanical pressure to singulate the die. The apparatus includes a pad for supporting the wafer and a pressure mechanism to apply the pressure.
* The method includes applying a photo resist layer, patterning it to form openings over the scribe lines, etching trenches along the scribe lines, applying adhesive tape on the back surface of the wafer, and applying pressure to singulate the die along the trenches. Optional steps include back-grinding the wafer to reduce its thickness and using a ring to hold the wafer in place during singulation.

<summary>

• The text describes a foil electron multiplier invention.
• The multiplier uses a series of thin foils in an evacuated enclosure to amplify electrons or detect particles.
• Each foil has a voltage applied to accelerate electrons and generate secondary electrons, which continue to the next foil.
• The gain of the multiplier is maximized by optimizing electron transmission, grid transmission, and secondary electron emission yield.
• The mean gain of the multiplier with N stages is given by Equation 2.
• The gain advantage of the foil electron multiplier over conventional multipliers is the term γ SE +1, which represents the continuation of primary electrons with secondary electrons they generate.
• Ion feedback in electron multipliers is resolved in the foil electron multiplier by ions being accelerated towards the previous stage but unable to penetrate the foil.
• The foil dimensions range from 0.5 cm to 2×4 cm, with carbon being the preferred material due to its thinness and uniformity.
• The foil thickness ranges from 0.2 μg/cm 2 to 2 μg/cm 2, with a preferred range of 0.2 to 1 μg/cm 2.
• The foil electron multiplier was demonstrated to have a higher gain efficiency than conventional electron multipliers.

</summary>

* The present invention introduces a high temperature polymeric seal support that directly surrounds and compresses the glass envelope of a subminiature lamp, providing a liquid-tight seal and eliminating the need for adhesives or cement.
* The polymeric seal support is made of a non-thermally conducting material, such as a fluoroelastomer, and can be molded or bored out to fit the glass envelope and conductive base. It also allows for closer tolerance centering of the subminiature lamp to the axis of the base, reducing interference fits and improving sealing efficiency.

<summary>

• The 3-D Phenomenoscope invention utilizes signals to synchronize lens filters to lateral motion in motion pictures and control the 3-dimensional visual effect.
• The invention does not require alteration to the motion picture or control information placement.
• The invention uses a computer algorithm to calculate synchronization events in real-time from multiple media frames.
• The invention has no moving parts or wire connections and uses material that partially occludes or entirely clears in response to electronic signals.
• The invention allows any motion picture with sustained lateral motion to be viewed with a 3-dimensional effect.
• The invention works regardless of the motion picture format or presentation media.
• The invention solves problems related to synchronization and control in motion pictures.
• The invention builds upon prior art references, including Steenblik, Takahaski, Beard, Hirano, Davino, and Laden.
• The invention uses a Glass Lens Controller Unit (GLCU) with a digital sensor, processor, and battery to process and identify synchronization events and control the state of the left and right lenses.

</summary>

• The invention describes an antenna array using at least four antennae spaced to form two equi-spaced linear triplets perpendicular to a ground plane. Each triplet's information signals are combined and divided to obtain a quotient signal, which is a function of the elevation angle but not the ground reflection coefficient.
• The array can operate in both receive and transmit modes. In the receive mode, unambiguous angle measurement is provided by the signal processing circuits. In the transmit mode, the transmitted signal from each antenna must be coded for quotient derivation in a remote receiver.
• The design aims to provide unambiguous angle measurements, measurement accuracy, and resolution, using the smallest number of antenna elements, and to optimize the height and spacing of each triplet for maximum sensitivity and amplitude.

* The present invention provides an electroluminescent display panel that can display different colors without using an intermediate electrode, allowing for a simpler and more cost-effective structure.
* The display panel consists of a first luminescent layer emitting green light and a second luminescent layer emitting orange or red light, which can be selectively activated by changing the voltage level to display various colors, including green, lemon (mixture of green and orange), yellow (mixture of green and red), and blue (in place of red color filter).

<summary>

- The present invention relates to a field emission display device with a protection structure that includes at least one reduction plate or electrode to deflect ionized gases away from the cathode and prevent electrical surges that may cause burnout damage to field emission elements.
- The reduction plate or electrode is typically provided on the cathode and is negatively charged by a bias voltage source to attract positive nitrogen and oxygen ions and prevent them from contacting the cathode.
- In operation, high-energy electrons emitted from field emission elements strike molecular nitrogen and oxygen, forming N+ and O+ ions. These ions are deflected to the reduction plate instead of the cathode, preventing ion-induced surges in electrical current.
- The protection structure can include multiple, elongated reduction plates or electrodes that run parallel and adjacent to rows of field emission elements or arranged in a meshwork- or net-shaped pattern among the field emission elements.
- The reduction plates can be fabricated on the cathode plate at the same time as the cathode strips using photolithography techniques.
- The invention prolongs the lifetime of the field emission display device by preventing burnout damage caused by electrical surges induced by ionized gases.

</summary>

<summary>

- The text describes a home network system where devices can serve as both network master and slave nodes, with the master node performing network administrative functions.
- Power management is important in home networks to minimize energy consumption, but it's difficult for a master node to enter power save mode while performing network administrative functions.
- The text proposes a method for transferring network administrative functions from a master node to a slave node, allowing the master node to enter power save mode and minimize energy consumption.
- The method involves the master node sending data to the slave node, enabling it to perform the administrative functions, and then entering power save mode.
- The slave node that receives the data becomes the new master node and performs the administrative functions.
- The text also discusses a method for selecting the best qualified slave node to become the new master node when the current master node enters power save mode.
- The system allows for intermittent or post-nominal function performance transfer, and the slave node automatically promotes itself to master node if necessary.

</summary>

• The text describes a method for realizing a GDFE Precoder for multi-user (MU) MIMO systems, reducing computational cost while maintaining capacity.
• The method relaxes the requirement for knowledge of the covariance matrix (S zz ) corresponding to "Least Favorable Noise" in the conventional design of a GDFE Precoder.
• The described implementation achieves significant improvement in computational cost over conventional GDFE Precoders.
• The text presents a method for configuring a GDFE Precoder in a base station of a MU-MIMO wireless system, including computing a filter matrix C and determining a transmit filter matrix B, feedforward filter matrix F, and interference pre-cancellation matrix G.
• The text also describes an alternate method for computing the matrix C without the use of S zz .
• The text includes numerical examples illustrating the computation of various matrices involved in the design of GDFE Precoders using different methods.

* The invention provides a receiver input circuit with multiple amplification control loops to prevent unwanted signal actuation of non-linear components, protect against overloading and frequency influences, and support each other with lower response threshold and frequency band width.
* The circuit includes a PIN diode control network, rectifier circuits, and a control signal processing circuit, with the operating current of the total circuit remaining constant during amplification control and no substantial additional control power requirement. The use of a buffer amplifier or amplifier component between the signal voltage and rectifier circuit helps minimize signal distortions.

* The present invention relates to a method for optimizing the visual impact of an advertising clip inserted into a video sequence by accounting for the regions of interest of the video sequence and the advertising clip, ensuring continuity between them.
* The method involves generating salience maps for the video sequence and each advertising clip, determining the degree of similarity between their salience maps using various methods, and selecting the clip with the highest degree of similarity to insert at the insertion point in the video sequence.

• The text describes an electronic portable communications terminal for Internet/network telephony that uses a network and/or the Internet for transferring information/data representing digitized speech, sounds, music, etc. The terminal increases flexibility with respect to wireless communication/connection with a network and/or the Internet and does not require specialized equipment and functionality to provide a connection.
• The terminal comprises audio means, converting means, protocol means, and wireless communications means. The audio means reproduce and record sound, the converting means convert sound into transmission data and received data into electrical signals, the protocol means handle and control communication of data in accordance with a standardized Internet/network protocol, and the wireless communications means enable wireless near field communication of data with a connecting unit. The terminal also communicates additional information and/or data with the connecting unit and establishes a connection to a service server on the network and/or the Internet.

<summary>

- The present invention relates to an image sensor with multiple imaging planes, allowing for information to be recorded through an edge surface of the sensor.
- The image sensor comprises a semiconductor substrate, image sensor elements with charge collection and transfer means and image sensing regions, and means for guiding charge carriers towards the charge collection and transfer means.
- The image sensor includes an elongated substrate with imaging planes on the top surface and two edge surfaces, and doped layers that create a waveguide-like structure adjacent the edges.
- The increased doping levels in the P + layers on the top and bottom surfaces create a barrier to electron movement, effectively guiding charge carriers back towards the middle of the substrate.
- The image sensor can be used to image in a plurality of planes, making it suitable for various image formats such as those involving the simultaneous imaging of two opposing surfaces or the surface imaging of passageways.
- Each image sensor element includes an image sensing region, a buried-channel CCD, a storage gate, a transfer gate, and a clock phase terminal.
- The thickness of the epitaxial layer is important as it determines the effective vertical aperture dimension in the edges of the sensor.
- A second embodiment of the image sensor includes CCDs that extend to the edges, increasing the lateral extent of the depletion region and improving charge collection and reducing crosstalk.
- The image sensor can be mounted on an insulated support block, with bond pads shifted to the ends to avoid interference with imaging surfaces, and can be used for various applications, including color applications.

</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to setting up a collaborative work-share environment between parties during a telephone call.
• Each party has a collaboration button and indicator on their telephone set.
• When the indicator is illuminated, network-enabled applications can be run on individual users' desktop computers for sharing information and conducting video conferences.
• The telephone is used for regular voice-only calls, but determines if richer collaboration is possible between parties.
• If collaboration is possible, the indicator on at least one telephone is lit, and parties can initiate document sharing or video conferencing by pushing the collaboration button.
• The voice path remains unaffected during collaboration setup.
• The system can be implemented using IP-based PBX systems and LANs, and can be extended to the Internet.
• The invention includes various flowcharts and diagrams illustrating the call setup, collaboration indicator illumination, and collaboration application launch processes.
</summary>

* The text describes an invention for a downconverting analog-to-digital converter that utilizes predictive coding principles to eliminate complexities introduced by discrete-time analog circuitry.
* The invention places the sampler inside the predictive loop, allowing the predictive filter to be implemented using digital signal processing techniques and reducing the complexity of the converter design.
* The predictive loop filter can be adapted to match the characteristics of the input signal, achieving higher dynamic range and lower quantization noise performance with lower order and less complex predictive loops.
* The invention also includes a dynamic range extension feature using the digital output of the loop to generate a signal for controlling a variable gain amplifier placed at the front of the predictive loop input, and an offset nulling digital signal processing element to provide an estimate of offsets introduced by various circuits and eliminate them from the error signal.

<summary>
• The invention relates to a recessed mask structure to prevent high electrical fields and reduce electrical breakdown in very small dimension semiconductor devices.
• In the sub-250 nanometer dimension range, high electrical fields can cause electrical breakdown at pointed regions between conductive regions, damaging the diffusion barrier liner and allowing metal conductor migration.
• The invention positions the mask member below the surface to be planarized, where there is a lower electric field, to protect the dielectric and maintain the integrity of the conductive liner.
• The mask position is in the range of about 0.5 to 20 nanometers below the surface, with 5 nanometers being preferred.
• The invention is particularly useful in damascene type device structures, where adjacent conductors are lined with a conductive diffusion barrier film and disposed in thin trenches in an intralevel dielectric material.
• The recessed mask structure results in a lower and predictable overall capacitance, leading to faster signal propagation in interconnect wiring.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to a heat-dissipating fan and housing thereof, which enlarges the intake airflow area without modifying assembling conditions.
• The housing includes an outer frame with a passage for guiding air streams, and an sidewall of the passage extends radially outwards to enlarge intake or discharge area for the air streams.
• The sidewall of the passage can extend radially outwardly with respect to a central or longitudinal axis of the passage and beyond the peripheral edge of the outer frame.
• The sidewall of the passage can be formed with an inclined portion or beveled edge.
• The heat-dissipating device includes an impeller and housing, with a passage for guiding air streams and an sidewall of the passage at least one of the opening sides extending radially outwards to enlarge intake/discharge area for the air streams.
• The blade dimension of the impeller increases along with the radially outwardly extending direction of the sidewall of the passage.
• The housing includes an air inlet, air outlet, and passage, and an sidewall of the passage at the air inlet side extends radially outwards to enlarge intake area of the air streams.
• The heat-dissipating system includes a casing, electrical elements, and heat-dissipating device, with a housing having a passage and an sidewall of the passage at one of the openings extending radially outwardly to enlarge intake/discharge area for the air streams.
• The heat-dissipating device is an axial fan and includes a heat sink assembled with the housing.
• The invention enhances heat-dissipating efficiency by increasing intake airflow area and concentrating air streams to the central portion of the heat sink.
</summary>

* The present invention relates to a method of singulating and plating semiconductor packages, employing plating of the side surfaces of the leads to prevent contamination.
* The method involves providing a plurality of semiconductor dies coupled to a leadframe, singulating the dies, and plating the exposed side surfaces of the leads with a different material than the leads.
* The leads can be copper, and the plating material can be a metallic material such as tin, silver, gold, nickel-gold, nickel-palladium, or nickel-palladium-gold.
* The leadframe can have a top and bottom surface, and the singulation process can involve performing a full cut or partial cuts, with plating occurring between or after the cuts.
* The side surfaces of the semiconductor packages can have a step or beveled portion formed from the plating material.
* The method can prevent oxidation on the leads, improving the soldering result when the semiconductor package is attached to a printed circuit board.

* The present invention relates to an apparatus for preparing foam sheet samples for microscopic examination, allowing for precise and uniform cuts with parallel edges.
* The apparatus includes a base structure, clamping arrangement, and a screw thread specimen advance mechanism, enabling the preparation of repetitive samples with uniform thickness and parallel cut edges.

<summary>

- Pb/Bi-containing high-dielectric materials are convenient for semiconductor circuitry but have issues with reactivity and formation of low dielectric constant layers.
- Ge buffer layers can prevent or minimize the formation of low dielectric constant layers and enhance epitaxy.
- BaTiO3 (BT) and SrTiO3 (ST) are thermodynamically stable next to Ge and can be used as buffer layers between Pb/Bi-containing ferroelectrics and Ge or Si substrates.
- SrTiO3 or BaTiO3 can also be used as buffer layers between Pt and PZT to improve properties.
- A second ferroelectric layer can be used as a chemical buffer layer to act as a diffusion barrier and nucleation layer.
- Ge buffer layers have prevented the formation of low dielectric layers at the interface prior to epitaxy in BST on Si.
- A MOS transistor with a ferroelectric (MFS) instead of SiO2 as the gate insulator can be used as a non-volatile, non-destructive readout memory.
- A Ge buffer layer allows many stable ferroelectrics to be used in a RAM.
- A second buffer layer of SrTiO3 or some other stable ferroelectric can allow even most chemically reactive ferroelectric oxides to be used in a RAM.
- Germanium (doped or undoped) is the only material that reacts neither with the semiconductor substrate nor the high dielectric constant oxide at the required annealing temperatures and provides for epitaxial growth of a conductive or semiconductive material on a semiconductor substrate.

</summary>

• The text describes a new process for producing multilayered components, specifically electrical components such as capacitors and coils.
• The process involves providing carriers (decals) with electrodes screen-printed on them, followed by the deposition of electrical components in the electrodes.
• The sub-assemblies are then brought into mutually stacked relation and the carriers are removed, allowing for precision registration and the formation of resultant assemblies.
• The new process eliminates the need for large laminating forces and prevents density distortions, which obviates delamination problems.
• The process also allows for smaller parts, lower voltage ratings, no shape limitations, enhanced in-process inspection, and the elimination of cutting stress cracks and internal delamination.
• The text also mentions the adaptability of this process to other electronic ceramic devices, such as multilayer ferrite inductors, and the fabrication of precision registers, semiconductor packages, and multilayer substrates.

<summary>

- The present invention relates to making and using sensors with nanodimensional features that respond to molecular compounds, organisms, or gas molecules using active solid state devices and nanowires or nanotubes.
- Nanowires and nanotubes have high sensitivity for molecular detection due to the depletion or accumulation of charge carriers caused by binding of biological macromolecules at the surface.
- Nanoimprint Lithography (NIL) is used to pattern nano-scale features into a quartz plate, which can be applied directly to the surface of a wafer to transfer the pattern 1:1 into a photoresist layer.
- NIL solves the problem of limited minimum feature sizes and high cost by allowing for the direct transfer of patterns from the template to the wafer.
- A multiplex detection array is created by fabricating electrical base structures, including semiconductor nanotraces between electrodes, and preparing the imprint pattern for the semiconductor nanotraces using NIL.
- The set of parallel semiconductor nanotraces on each sensor device in the multiplex detection array is functionalized with a sensitizing compound, such as nucleic acid sequences, to create a unique anchor probe library for each sensor device.
- The multiplex detection array with anchored probes is packaged onto an electronics board and connected using wire or bump bonding.
- The presence of a target molecule is detected by measuring changes in electrical current in the external circuit when the target binds with its complementary anchored probe sequence on a sensor device in the multiplex detection array.

</summary>

<summary>
• The present invention relates to a method for preparing a superconducting device using a blocking film or passivation film to prevent the removal of oxygen from the surface of an oxide superconducting material.
• The method involves forming a film on the surface of the superconducting material using a photo CVD method, followed by adding oxygen to the surface or portion close to the surface and heat treating to form a dense insulating material.
• The films used for this purpose can be insulating films such as silicon nitride, aluminum nitride, or oxidized metals or semiconductors.
• The method can be used with various oxide superconducting materials, including those formed into tablets or thin films, and can be activated with long-term stability and high reliability.
• The use of a thin film structure and the present invention's method can effectively fill the micro-holes or spaces in the oxide superconducting material, improving its reliability.
</summary>

• The text describes a sandwich panel core made of a hierarchical lattice structure with synergistically arranged trusses.
• The lattice structure results in a hollow core, maintaining a low weight while providing high specific stiffness and strength.
• Sandwich panels have various applications, including transportation, ballistics, thermal transfer, and construction materials.
• An aspect of the invention includes a structure with a primary array and an ancillary array, where the ancillary array is nested with the primary array.
• The primary array has a first primary array with first order cells and at least one second order cell, while the ancillary array has a second order array with at least one third order cell.
• The second order cells of the ancillary array are essentially coaligned with the second order cells of the first primary array, the first order cells of the first primary array, or both.
• The structure may also include a second lattice structure mated with the first lattice structure, where at least one first order cell of the first primary array is oppositely oriented to and essentially coaligned with at least one first order cell of the second primary array.
• The lattice structures can be fabricated using various methods, including injection molding, investment casting, and die casting.
• The text also mentions related patent applications and scientific articles.
• The invention is not limited to the specific embodiments described and various modifications and equivalents are possible.

* The invention describes a process for co-producing power and hydrocarbons using an Integrated Gasification Combined Cycle (IGCC) plant and a coal-to-liquid (CTL) facility. The process includes gasifying coal in a wet gasification stage to produce combustion gas with a high hydrogen content and in a dry gasification stage to produce synthesis gas precursor. The combustion gas is then enriched with hydrogen and used to generate power, while the synthesis gas precursor is mixed with the hydrogen-enriched gas and used for hydrocarbon synthesis.
* The process offers economic and environmental benefits, including the production of a high-pressure combustion gas in the wet gasification stage, which reduces the steam requirement for hydrogen enrichment, and the use of a waste heat boiler in the dry gasification stage to produce process steam, enhancing overall energy efficiency. The IGCC and CTL facilities share utilities and an air separation unit, reducing costs and improving plant efficiency. Fuel gas produced by the CTL facility is used as fuel in the IGCC facility, and CO2 from both facilities is captured and sequestered or used for enhanced oil or coal-bed methane recovery.

<summary>

- The invention describes a method for a mobile terminal to select a serving base station of a wireless wide area network (WWAN) in a communication system. The mobile terminal receives service information from a second base station in the WLAN, which contains information about the first base stations in the WWAN.
- The mobile terminal uses this information to skip some initial scanning procedures and accelerate the connecting process to the WWAN. If the first wireless module fails to connect to the serving base station using the service information, it starts scanning the first base stations according to the channel information in the service information.
- The method includes turning on the first wireless module according to a first rule, receiving the service information from the second base station, transmitting the service information to the first wireless module, and selecting one of the first base stations as a serving base station according to the service information.
- The second base station in the WLAN gathers the service information of the first base stations and sends it to the mobile terminal when it connects. The mobile terminal uses this information to connect to the WWAN more quickly and efficiently.

</summary>

The invention describes a method for a mobile terminal to select a serving base station of a wireless wide area network (WWAN) in a communication system. The mobile terminal receives service information from a second base station in the WLAN, which contains information about the first base stations in the WWAN. The mobile terminal uses this information to skip some initial scanning procedures and accelerate the connecting process to the WWAN. If the first wireless module fails to connect to the serving base station using the service information, it starts scanning the first base stations according to the channel information in the service information. The method includes turning on the first wireless module according to a first rule, receiving the service information from the second base station, transmitting the service information to the first wireless module, and selecting one of the first base stations as a serving base station according to the service information. The second base station in the WLAN gathers the service information of the first base stations and sends it to the mobile terminal when it connects. The mobile terminal uses this information to connect to the WWAN more quickly and efficiently.

<summary>

• The invention relates to a method and apparatus for determining the angle of inclination of a seismometer, especially an ocean bottom seismometer (OBS), and for leveling its seismic motion detectors.
• Seismometers, including OBSs, are used in geological research, particularly oil and gas exploration. OBSs are designed for remote operation on the ocean floor and require good seismic coupling to the earth.
• The present invention provides a simple and inexpensive method for determining the angle of inclination of a seismometer and preserving its orientation for later measurement.
• The invention uses a geophone suspended at the end of a shaft connected to a spherical ball, which forms a simple pendulum. The geophone is mounted in a horizontal annular seat, allowing symmetrical freedom of motion.
• A plunger with a synthetic rubber head is used to lock the spherical ball, shaft, and geophone in their assumed orientation when the plunger head comes into contact with the ball.
• A coil spring is used to compress the plunger and provide sufficient force to lock the spherical ball against the annular seat.
• A solenoid is used to remove a pin restraining the plunger from contacting the spherical ball, allowing the plunger to extend and lock the seismometer in place.
• The invention can be used to level multiple seismic motion detectors, as long as they are mounted with their operating axes parallel or perpendicular to the line passing through the center of gravity of the detector and the central longitudinal axis of the shaft.
• The invention can be used with various materials and techniques for constructing the seismometer and mounting the invention, as long as seismic vibrations are transmitted without significant dampening or filtering.

</summary>

<summary>
• The text describes a system and method for generating a mobile time reference in a 3G portable transceiver using a high frequency oscillator and a low frequency oscillator.
• The mobile time reference is constantly running and has an accuracy of approximately 32 nanoseconds, and is used by the WCDMA modem to create a mobile time reference for the portable transceiver.
• The system includes a free running counter that operates in two time domains, 30.72 MHz in active mode and 32 KHz in idle mode, and maintains the mobile time reference during idle mode to reduce power consumption and extend battery life.
</summary>

• The invention is a multiorifice structure made by fusing concentric layers of solid rods and cylindrical members, where each successive layer of rods is disposed at a progressively larger angle with respect to the axis of the fused assembly. The structure is then cut into thin wafers, resulting in angularly disposed passageways with increasing angles as a function of their distance from the center.
• The multiorifice structure has a plurality of passageways angularly disposed with respect to a common axis, and the angular displacement of the passageways increases as a function of their displacement from the center.
• The invention provides a method for making a multiorifice structure by fusing concentric layers of alternating cylindrical members and angularly disposed rods into an integral assembly, and slicing the assembly to produce a plurality of multiorifice structures with angularly disposed passageways.

• The present invention describes a humidity sensing element made of a tubular aluminum first electrode, anodized and impregnated with nickel particles, and a second electrode formed by vacuum-deposited nickel. The element is sealed and hydrolized to reduce porosity and improve contact between the nickel particles and the ion-forming material.
• The impedance between the electrodes varies linearly with the relative humidity of the surrounding gaseous atmosphere when excited by a suitable alternating current voltage. The sensor is physically sturdy, non-hygroscopic, and does not require special housing or mechanical movements.
• The manufacturing process includes anodizing the aluminum, vacuum-depositing nickel particles, sealing and hydrolizing the anodized layer, and depositing a thin, water vapor pervious second electrode. The preferred method uses oxalic acid anodizing and nickel vacuum deposition.

<summary>
• The present invention provides an enhanced radio telephone that can be used as an improved IP telephone, allowing for selective operation as a conventional radio telephone or an IP telephone.
• The enhanced radio telephone includes an internal speech coder for low power consumption and effective IP telephony, reducing speech delay and eliminating the need for a high-performance PC.
• The enhanced radio telephone handset is convenient for speech conversation and reduces echo problems commonly associated with conventional IP telephones.
• The enhanced radio telephone is connected to a PC via a serial or parallel port or wirelessly using IR or short range radio, allowing for digital speech and control signaling to be passed between the devices.
• IP-telephone control can be initiated from either the PC or the enhanced radio telephone, and the enhanced radio telephone can be manually or automatically switched between ordinary wireless operation and IP-telephone operation.
• In alternative embodiments, the enhanced radio telephone is also used for wireless data communication in order to carry IP speech, allowing for IP data transfer using a separate connection or the same connection used for speech and control signaling.
</summary>

• The invention provides methods to improve the controllability of the width of the oxide portion on the gate sidewall in the fabrication of semiconductor devices, prevent hot-carrier injection into the oxide portion from degrading the transconductance, and reduce resistances of elements such as the gate electrode.
• The methods include forming an insulating film on the gate electrode and the sidewall, anisotropically etching away a portion of the insulating film using RIE, and forming the high density region of the source/drain by ion injection using the insulating film and the gate electrode as masks. Alternatively, the oxide film portion on the sidewall can be formed of a high melting point metal or a silicide of such a metal. Additionally, a conductive layer or polycrystalline semiconductor layer can be formed and anisotropically etched away to form the portion on the gate sidewall, and the gate electrode or the gate electrode and the source/drain region can be silicided in fabricating the insulated gate field effect semiconductor device having the LDD structure.

<summary>

- The text describes an invention for an individually fitted helmet liner that can be rapidly and simply fitted to a wearer's head and refitted to accommodate changed head sizes.
- The helmet liner consists of multiple layers of elastic thermoplastic sheets, each with an array of hollow spherical pockets that are open and unfilled.
- The liner is fitted by heating the sheets to a plastic state, placing the liner between an outer fixture and the wearer's head, and removing the liner when it has cooled to a rigid, nonplastic state.
- The unfilled pockets allow the layers to conform to the wearer's head contours, eliminating the need for drawstrings and reducing the tendency for the helmet to shift position.
- The liner is manufactured by vacuum-forming the thermoplastic sheets over hemispherical domes with regularly spaced hollow spherical protuberances.
- The liner is available in six basic sizes to accommodate a typical range of head sizes, with adjacent layers nesting together to provide the desired accommodation.
- The liner can be repeatedly refitted to different individuals or to the same individual with changed head sizes, as long as the new size is within the same size range.

</summary>

<summary>

- The invention relates to a scraped surface heat exchanger and a method for mounting blades onto the drive shaft using a pin type connection.
- The blade design includes a blade body with a first side, a second side, a scraper edge, a hinge edge, and at least one mounting hole.
- The blade also features L-shaped locking tracks on both sides, each with an entry track and an intermediate track.
- The pin design includes an inner finger and an outer finger, and is mounted to the drive shaft.
- During installation, the blade is placed at an angle relative to the pins and aligned with the entry tracks. The outer finger slides into the entry tracks, and the inner finger slides into the entry tracks and the mounting holes.
- The blade is then rotated downward into an installation position, where it is held in place by interference between the top of the finger and the top edge of the opening, and the top edge of the outer finger and the top of the intermediate track.
- The design ensures that the blade stays oriented and does not slide down or fall off the pins, even in a vertical orientation.
- The provision of locking tracks on both sides of the blade reduces the amount of thinned track blade area compared to a single track design, while maintaining structural rigidity.

</summary>

<summary>

- The text describes a motor assembly with a force transmission structure for a window lift system.
- Conventional designs use a cylindrical coupling end between the drive plate and shaft, leading to reverse forces and vibration.
- The present invention provides a force transmission structure with a Y-shaped mounting hole and toothed portion, allowing the shaft to be fixed to rotate with the drive plate.
- The drive plate has a body, coupling, protrusions, and ribs. The coupling has a Y-shaped mounting hole and buffer holes.
- The shaft has a toothed portion and pinion.
- The motor assembly includes a motor, force transmission structure, and gear train.
- The damper is received between the inner and outer rings of the worm gear and engages with the protrusions of the drive plate.
- The Y-shaped toothed portion of the shaft fits into the Y-shaped mounting hole of the drive plate, and a circlip holds the shaft in place.
- The invention provides a stable and quiet rotation of the shaft, increased contact area between teeth and coupling, and reduced noise and vibration due to the use of an engineering plastics material for the drive plate.

</summary>

Note: The summary is based on the provided text and may not include all the details of the invention. For a complete understanding, it is recommended to read the entire text.

* The present invention relates to wave energy converters that utilize submerged devices to capture energy from surface waves using overhead wave-induced subsurface differences in hydrostatic pressure and/or enhanced surge or pitch.
* The invention addresses the challenges of high cost and low energy capture efficiency of current wave energy converter designs, particularly those that are submerged and deployed near the sea bed.
* The invention uses gas-filled or evacuated containers to produce container deformation in response to overhead swell and trough-induced static pressure changes.
* The invention captures both hydrostatic (heave) and hydrokinetic wave energy (surge or pitch), which represents half of all wave energy.
* The invention enhances or supplements energy capture with overhead floating bodies.
* The invention reduces mass and increases energy capture efficiency by using partial evacuation or surface venting.
* The invention uses a flexible, gas-tight, reinforced elastomer or flexible metal bellows or diaphragm to connect the fixed and movable ends of the containers.
* The invention uses hydraulic or pneumatic pumping means or mechanical or electrical drive means to transfer the linear motion between the containers' fixed and movable ends to generate power.
* The invention can be oriented vertically or horizontally and can capture lateral wave surge energy or in any other orientation.
* The invention uses a force multiplier or leveraged connecting means and/or multi-staged or multiple sequenced drive cylinders to increase stroke while maintaining higher capture efficiency.

• The text describes a method for charging and balancing the voltages of cells in a battery pack to support a desired drive range.
• The method involves determining the maximum capacity of each cell, calculating the common voltage needed for each cell, and determining the charge time for the battery pack.
• If the pack charge time is greater than the maximum resistive circuitry activation times, the cells are balanced using resistive circuitry before charging. Otherwise, the cells are charged and balanced simultaneously.

<summary>

- The invention relates to a process and apparatus for detecting and eliminating defective or incorrectly positioned cigarettes in a cigarette magazine of a cigarette-production or packaging machine.
- The process uses an optical checking element, such as a camera, to scan and evaluate images of cigarettes in the magazine. Deviations from reference images or values result in an error signal.
- The apparatus includes an optical checking element, image-processing device, and means to produce an error signal. It monitors a large area of cigarettes, providing an overview of their orientation.
- The invention can also be used to register defective cigarettes, such as those with missing filters or bent or broken cigarettes.
- The elimination process involves detecting a defective or incorrectly positioned cigarette and actuating an ejecting unit to eject a plurality of cigarettes located in an assigned ejecting zone.
- The elimination apparatus includes multiple adjacent ejecting units, each with a large enough ejecting zone to eject a transversely located cigarette in full. Multiple adjacent ejecting zones and units are provided to avoid ejecting cigarettes over the entire width of the magazine.

</summary>

Additionally, the invention includes features such as different-sized and contoured front and rear walls of the ejecting unit to prevent jamming, and the use of a tobacco-recycling circuit to minimize waste when ejecting cigarettes. The process and apparatus can be used with multiple cameras and evaluation zones, and the ejecting unit can be manually triggered or actuated for reasons other than automatic detection.

* The present invention relates to a simplified connection system for high voltage cables, providing a common interface for all accessories and interconnections, resulting in advantages such as factory pretesting, reduced installation time and cost, and simplified field testing.
* The system uses an outer cone concept, where the outer cone separates the cable connection further from the apparatus it is connected to, making it less likely for a fault at one side to affect the other side. The inner cone concept and a plane surface interconnection are also possible.
* The invention includes components such as a cable termination with a stress relief cone and a voltage deflector, an interface device with a rigid insulating body and a conical interface surface, and various applications such as SF6 terminals, transformer terminals, out-door terminals, and joints between cables and apparatus. The rigid insulator used in the invention has a conical interface surface with an angle between 15° and 45°.

• The invention provides a new approach to maintenance of illumination in a space using a single sensor or averaged reading from multiple interior sensors to control both electric lights and window treatments.
• The system eliminates the need for exterior sensors and complex data gathering and setup procedures, reducing overall system cost.
• The invention allows for sun glare in the interior space to be controlled, providing near optimal illumination control and energy savings.

* The invention describes a tool-fixing mechanism with curved connecting surfaces for improved security and simplicity in various applications, including machining, robotics, and pneumatic tools.
* The mechanism consists of a tool, a tool frame, a tool holder, and clamps. The tool frame and tool holder have curved connecting surfaces that allow the tool and its frame to be easily placed and secured in the tool holder.
* The curved surfaces are designed to meet specific radius and distance requirements to ensure proper fit and function. The tool frame and tool holder can be arranged with spherical curved surfaces or with one spherical and one flat surface.
* The clamps provide pressure and frictional contact to secure the tool and transmit forces in multiple directions. The clamps can be designed with various mounting elements and opening-groove systems to facilitate tool attachment and release.

<summary>
• The text describes an AC-to-DC converter as a lamp power supply that converts an AC input voltage to a constant DC voltage, reducing eye fatigue and preventing myopia.
• The converter includes an input protection circuit, EMI filter, rectifier, filter, converter, output filter, lamp, start circuit, control circuit, biasing circuit, sampling circuit, output protection circuit, and input monitor circuit.
• The power supply can be implemented using various filter, rectifier, converter, and controller types, and can include protection circuits for over voltage, over current, and over temperature.
</summary>

<summary>
• The text describes methods and apparatus for generating supply voltages for display driver circuits with high efficiencies and low EMI.
• Switching regulator circuits with multiple circuit paths carrying current in opposite directions are used to cancel out radiated noise.
• Terminal leads are added to act as RF antennas and sink any EMI generated in the outermost paths.
• The text discusses a boost regulator circuit and its operation in detail.
• The use of indium tin oxide (ITO) as a bonding wire in a switching regulator circuit is described, along with the high resistance and the need for multiple traces to reduce it.
• The text explains the problems associated with the use of regulators like regulator 300 in driving displays due to the large amount of EMI produced.
• A switching regulator 400 is introduced, which operates in accordance with the principles of the present invention to provide a high efficiency output with low EMI emissions.
</summary>

• The text identifies challenges with current surface transportation programs, including lack of clear goals, insufficient links to performance, and uncertain fiscal sustainability.
• The text recommends principles for restructuring and funding federal surface transportation programs, including creating well-defined goals, establishing the federal role, incorporating performance and accountability, employing the best tools and approaches, and ensuring fiscal sustainability.

* Before September 2001, significant vulnerabilities existed in aviation security, including weaknesses in passenger and baggage screening, airport access controls, and air traffic control computer systems.
* In response, the Transportation Security Administration (TSA) was created and mandated to establish security requirements with deadlines. TSA took major steps to increase aviation security over the past 2 years, including implementing congressional mandates and exploring options for technology and information to control access to secure areas and improve passenger screening.
* TSA faces longer-term challenges in risk management, funding, coordination, strategic human capital management, and building a results-oriented organization to sustain enhanced aviation security.
* Ongoing work includes examining initiatives such as the Transportation Workers Identification Card (TWIC) program, the next-generation Computer Assisted Passenger Prescreening System (CAPPS II), and a registered traveler program.

• LDA and IRC sections 4911 and 162(e) were enacted at different times for different purposes. LDA requires organizations to register and report lobbying activities to provide greater public disclosure, while IRC sections 4911 and 162(e) do not have this purpose.
• LDA covers lobbying of federal officials only, while IRC sections 4911 and 162(e) cover lobbying of federal, state, and local officials. IRC sections 4911 and 162(e) also cover grassroots lobbying, which LDA does not.
• LDA covers more federal officials for nonlegislative matters and has broader coverage of legislative matters compared to IRC sections 4911 and 162(e). IRC sections 4911 and 162(e) have different definitions of grassroots lobbying and cover fewer executive branch officials for nonlegislative matters.

• The SEC's financial statements for fiscal years 2007 and 2006 were fairly presented in all material respects, but internal control deficiencies existed that could result in material misstatements.
• Significant control deficiencies were identified in the period-end financial reporting process, accounting for transaction fee revenue, preparing financial statement disclosures, and calculating accounts receivable for disgorgements and penalties. Additionally, weaknesses in information security, property and equipment controls, and accounting for budgetary resources were reported.

<summary>

• NCHIP is a federal grant program established in 1995 to improve criminal history records and facilitate their exchange between states and the FBI.
• The program has awarded over $438 million to states, the District of Columbia, and U.S. territories to automate and improve their criminal history record systems.
• NCHIP funds have primarily been used for NICS/III/criminal records improvements and disposition reporting improvements, with smaller amounts allocated for AFIS/Livescan activities, sex offender registry enhancements, protection order activities, and national security/antiterrorism activities.
• The priority states, which had the lowest levels of criminal history record automation in 1994, received additional funding under NCHIP and have made significant progress in automating their records.
• NCHIP funds have not been used to develop or implement a ballistics registration system.

</summary>

<summary>

- In 1993, the Institute of Medicine reported that approximately 60,000 military personnel were used as human experimental subjects during secret U.S. chemical weapons programs during World War II. The VA lacked information about these individuals.
- After exchanges of letters between Members of Congress, the President, and the Secretary of Defense, the Deputy Secretary of Defense issued a memo releasing all individuals from nondisclosure restrictions and directing efforts to declassify and provide information to VA.
- The Chemical Weapons Exposure Study Task Force was established to identify DOD personnel exposed to chemical substances during testing, training, transport, production, and storage. Approximately 6,400 servicemembers and civilians were identified.
- In 2003, the Defense Authorization Act required DOD to submit to Congress and the Secretary of Veterans Affairs a comprehensive plan for the review, declassification, and submittal of all DOD records and information on Project 112 relevant to VA's provision of benefits.

</summary>

<summary>

* The Postal Service had about 765,000 career employees in 1997, with a focus on the cluster-level EAS workforce, which consisted primarily of employees in EAS 11 through 26 positions.
* The Service's Diversity Development Department was established in 1992 to foster an all-inclusive business environment and promote equal employment opportunities.
* A study by Aguirre International in 1997 found that women and minorities were experiencing problems advancing to management jobs at EAS 17 and above positions.
* The Service developed an action plan in response to the Aguirre report and found that women and minorities were generally represented in and promoted to levels above EAS 17.
* The Service is making progress in implementing the 23 initiatives it developed in response to the Aguirre report, including efforts to better capture and use data to achieve diversity objectives.
</summary>

<summary>

• GAO has been advocating for strategic sourcing in federal acquisitions since 2002.
• Leading companies in the private sector committed to a strategic approach to services acquisition, resulting in structural changes and substantial savings.
• Strategic sourcing tactics include leveraged buying, managing demand, achieving efficiencies, evaluating total cost of ownership, and better managing supplier relationships.
• Spend analysis is crucial for efficient procurement and is used by private sector companies as a foundation for strategic sourcing.
• The federal government's procurement spending is decentralized, preventing full leverage of aggregate buying power.
• In 2005, OMB issued a memorandum directing agencies to develop and implement strategic sourcing efforts based on spend analysis results.
• The Federal Strategic Sourcing Initiative (FSSI) was established in 2005 to address government-wide opportunities to strategically source commonly purchased products and services.
• In 2012, GAO found that most agencies leveraged a small fraction of their buying power through strategic sourcing, with only 5% of federal procurement spending managed through strategic sourcing efforts.
• Challenges to strategic sourcing in the federal setting include obtaining and analyzing reliable data, securing expertise, and obtaining leadership commitment.
• Leading companies save 4-15% over prior year spending through strategic sourcing of services, including facilities management, engineering, and information technology.

</summary>

<summary>

• The Federal Aviation Administration (FAA) engages in three primary activities: aviation safety oversight, Air Traffic Control (ATC), and airport infrastructure development.
• The costs associated with safety activities are primarily driven by the volume of services provided, while ATC costs depend on the nature and usage of the services.
• The Airport Improvement Program (AIP) is a grant program that funds airport infrastructure development, and its expenditures are not directly linked to user costs.
• The Trust Fund was established in 1970 to help fund the development of a nationwide airport and airway system and is credited with revenues collected from system users through dedicated excise taxes.
• The current excise tax system has been successful in funding FAA but raises concerns regarding revenue adequacy, equity, and efficiency.
• Alternative funding options, such as relying solely on a fuel tax or increasing the passenger segment tax, have advantages and disadvantages and could address some of these concerns.
• Debt financing, such as borrowing from the Treasury or private capital market, could provide FAA with a stable source of revenue to fund capital projects but raises concerns regarding borrowing costs and federal budget scoring rules.
• The use of multiple funding options, such as en-route charges to fund en-route costs, flight segment charges to fund terminal control costs, and certification charges to fund safety costs, might best address concerns with the current system by providing a better link between revenues and costs.

</summary>

<summary>

- The Food Stamp Program provides benefits to eligible low-income households, with FNS funding and establishing regulations. States determine eligibility and issue benefits. Households can be certified for periods ranging from 1 to 24 months.
- FNS offers options and waivers to increase program access and reduce reporting burden, including options related to eligibility, reporting requirements, and TANF recipients. States are penalized for high payment error rates.
- Payment errors occur for various reasons, including mistakes by recipients and caseworkers, and inaccurate determination of household income. States use reporting options and waivers to reduce errors and simplify administration.

</summary>

<summary>

- The Comprehensive Environmental Response, Compensation, and Liability Act (CERCLA) established the Superfund program in 1980 to clean up hazardous waste sites.
- As of December 1996, there were 1,210 sites on the National Priorities List (NPL).
- EPA investigates contaminated sites, places them on the NPL, and determines appropriate cleanup remedies.
- Incineration, the burning of contaminated waste in a controlled environment, has been used at three operating Superfund sites and was planned for four additional sites.
- RCRA regulations apply to incinerators used at Superfund sites, requiring them to meet emissions standards and obtain operating permits.
- EPA uses four methods to ensure safe operation of Superfund incinerators: setting site-specific standards, incorporating safety features, monitoring emissions, and providing on-site oversight.
- Superfund incinerators do not always receive regular inspections, and EPA has not fully implemented its plans to systematically share lessons learned between sites.
- Incinerators at the three sites visited had additional safety measures beyond regulatory requirements, such as emergency systems to destroy residual contamination in the event of a shutdown.
- Air monitoring at Superfund sites is continuous and detailed, with emissions never exceeding permitted levels at the sites visited.
</summary>

<summary>
